33  /**
34  * @tparam T Type of comparison object (inferred)
35  * @param a Left-hand object for comparison
36  * @param b Right-hand object for comparison
37  *
38  * @return Smaller of a or b
39  */
40  template<class T>
41  constexpr T min(const T a, const T b) {
42  return (b < a) ? b : a;
43  }
44 
45  /**
46  * @tparam T Type of comparison object (inferred)
47  * @param a Left-hand object for comparison
48  * @param b Right-hand object for comparison
49  *
50  * @return Larger of a or b
51  */
52  template<class T>
53  constexpr T max(const T a, const T b) {
54  return (b > a) ? b : a;
55  }

59 /** Dummy port information for pins without an associated PCR */
60 constexpr PortInfo __attribute__((unused)) NoPortInfo {0, 0, (IRQn_Type)-1};
61

64 constexpr PortInfo __attribute__((unused)) PortAInfo {PORTA_BasePtr, (uint32_t)(PCC_BasePtr+offsetof(PCC_Type, PCC_PORTA)), PORTA_IRQn};
65 #endif

118 #endif

152 
153 /** Class to static check signal mapping is valid */
154 template<class Info, int signalNum> class CheckSignal {
155  static_assert((signalNum<Info::numSignals), "Non-existent signal - Modify Configure.usbdm");
156  static_assert((signalNum>=Info::numSignals)||(Info::info[signalNum].gpioBit != UNMAPPED_PCR), "Signal is not mapped to a pin - Modify Configure.usbdm");
157  static_assert((signalNum>=Info::numSignals)||(Info::info[signalNum].gpioBit != INVALID_PCR), "Signal doesn't exist in this device/package");
158  static_assert((signalNum>=Info::numSignals)||((Info::info[signalNum].gpioBit == UNMAPPED_PCR)||(Info::info[signalNum].gpioBit == INVALID_PCR)||(Info::info[signalNum].gpioBit >= 0)), "Illegal signal");
159 };
160 
161 /** Enables mapping of all allocated pins during startup using mapAllPins() */
162 static constexpr bool MAP_ALL_PINS = false;
163 
164 /** Used to configure pin-mapping before 1st use of peripherals */
165 extern void mapAllPins();

169 /*
170  * Peripheral Information Classes
171  */
172 /**
173  * @addtogroup OSC_Group OSC, Crystal Oscillator
174  * @brief Abstraction for Crystal Oscillator
175  * @{
176  */
177 #define USBDM_OSC0_IS_DEFINED
178 /**
179  * Peripheral information for OSC, Crystal Oscillator.
180  *
181  * This may include pin information, constants, register addresses, and default register values,
182  * along with simple accessor functions.
183  */
184 class Osc0Info {
185 public:
186  // Template:osc0_mk
187 
188  //! Hardware base address as uint32_t
189  static constexpr uint32_t baseAddress = OSC0_BasePtr;
190 
191  //! Hardware base pointer
192  __attribute__((always_inline)) static volatile OSC_Type &osc() {
193  return *(OSC_Type *)baseAddress;
194  }
195 
196  //! Base value for PCR (excluding MUX value)
197  static constexpr uint32_t defaultPcrValue = 0;
198 
199  //! Map all allocated pins on a peripheral when enabled
200  static constexpr bool mapPinsOnEnable = true;
201 
202  //! Frequency of OSC Clock or Crystal
203  static constexpr uint32_t osc_clock = 8000000UL;
204 
205  //! Frequency of 32K OSC Clock or Crystal (if applicable)
206  static constexpr uint32_t osc32k_clock = 0UL;
207 
208  //! Oscillator control register
209  static constexpr uint32_t cr =
210  OSC_CR_ERCLKEN(1) | // External Reference Enable
211  OSC_CR_EREFSTEN(0) | // External Reference Stop Enable
212  OSC_CR_SCP(2); // Oscillator load capacitance
213 
214  /**
215  * Get OSC clock (internal, assumed available)
216  *
217  * @return Clock frequency as uint32_t in Hz
218  */
219  static constexpr uint32_t getOscClock() {
220  return osc_clock;
221  }
222 
223  /**
224  * Get OSC clock (external, gated by OSC_CR_ERCLKEN)
225  *
226  * @return Clock frequency as uint32_t in Hz
227  */
228  static uint32_t getOscerClock() {
229  return (osc().CR&OSC_CR_ERCLKEN_MASK)?osc_clock:0;
230  }
231 
232  /**
233  * Get OSC32KCLK clock
234  *
235  * @return Clock frequency as uint32_t in Hz
236 
237  * @note This clock is only available if a 32kHz crystal or external clock is used
238  */
239  static uint32_t getOsc32kClock() {
240  return osc32k_clock;
241  }
242 
243  //! Number of signals available in info table
244  static constexpr int numSignals = 2;
245 
246  //! Information for each signal of peripheral
247  static constexpr PinInfo info[] = {
248 
249  // Signal Pin portInfo gpioAddress gpioBit PCR value
250  /* 0: XTAL0 = PTA19 (XTAL0) */ { PortAInfo, GPIOA_BasePtr, 19, PORT_PCR_MUX(0)|defaultPcrValue },
251  /* 1: EXTAL0 = PTA18 (EXTAL0) */ { PortAInfo, GPIOA_BasePtr, 18, PORT_PCR_MUX(0)|defaultPcrValue },
252  };
253 
254  /**
255  * Initialise pins used by peripheral
256  *
257  * @param pcrValue PCR value controlling pin options
258  */
259  static void initPCRs(uint32_t pcrValue=defaultPcrValue) {
260 #ifdef PCC_PCCn_CGC_MASK
261  PCC->PCC_PORTA = PCC_PCCn_CGC_MASK;
262 #else
263  enablePortClocks(PORTA_CLOCK_MASK);
264 #endif
265  PORTA->GPCHR = pcrValue|PORT_PCR_MUX(0)|PORT_GPCHR_GPWE(0x000CUL);
266  }
267 
268  /**
269  * Resets pins used by peripheral
270  */
271  static void clearPCRs() {
272 #ifdef PCC_PCCn_CGC_MASK
273  PCC->PCC_PORTA = PCC_PCCn_CGC_MASK;
274 #else
275  enablePortClocks(PORTA_CLOCK_MASK);
276 #endif
277  PORTA->GPCHR = PORT_PCR_MUX(0)|PORT_GPCHR_GPWE(0xCU);
278  }
279 
280 };
281 
282 /**
283  * End group OSC_Group
284  * @}
285  */
286 /**
287  * @addtogroup RTC_Group RTC, Real Time Clock
288  * @brief Abstraction for Real Time Clock
289  * @{
290  */
291 #define USBDM_RTC_IS_DEFINED
292 /**
293  * Peripheral information for RTC, Real Time Clock.
294  *
295  * This may include pin information, constants, register addresses, and default register values,
296  * along with simple accessor functions.
297  */
298 class RtcInfo {
299 public:
300  // Template:rtc_war_rar_tsie
301 
302  //! Hardware base address as uint32_t
303  static constexpr uint32_t baseAddress = RTC_BasePtr;
304 
305  //! Hardware base pointer
306  __attribute__((always_inline)) static volatile RTC_Type &rtc() {
307  return *(RTC_Type *)baseAddress;
308  }
309 
310  //! Base value for PCR (excluding MUX value)
311  static constexpr uint32_t defaultPcrValue =
312  PORT_PCR_LK(0) | // Lock Register
313  PORT_PCR_DSE(0) | // Drive Strength Enable
314  PORT_PCR_ODE(0) | // Open Drain Enable
315  PORT_PCR_PFE(0) | // Passive Filter Enable
316  PORT_PCR_SRE(0) | // Slew Rate Enable
317  PORT_PCR_PS(0); // Pull device
318 
319  //! Frequency of RTC External Clock or Crystal
320  static constexpr uint32_t osc_input_freq = 32768UL;
321 
322  //! Oscillator control register
323  static constexpr uint32_t cr =
324  RTC_CR_OSCE(1) | // Enables 32kHz oscillator [RTC_32K]
325  RTC_CR_CLKO(0) | // Disables RTC 32kHz Clock Output
326  RTC_CR_UM(0) | // Update Mode
327  RTC_CR_SUP(0) | // Supervisor access
328  RTC_CR_WPE(0) | // Wakeup Pin Enable
329  RTC_CR_SCP(2); // RTC Oscillator load capacitance
330 
331  //! RTC Time Compensation Register
332  static constexpr uint32_t tcr =
333  RTC_TCR_CIR(0) | // Compensation Interval Register
334  RTC_TCR_TCR(0); // Time Compensation Register
335 
336  //! RTC Lock Register
337  static constexpr uint32_t lr =
338  RTC_LR_LRL(1) | // Lock Register Lock
339  RTC_LR_SRL(1) | // Status Register Lock
340  RTC_LR_CRL(1) | // Control Register Lock
341  RTC_LR_TCL(1); // Time Compensation Lock
342 
343  #if defined(RTC_WAR_TSRW)
344  //! RTC Write Access Register
345  static constexpr uint32_t war =
346  RTC_WAR_IERW(1) | // Interrupt Enable Register Write
347  RTC_WAR_LRW(1) | // Lock Register Write
348  RTC_WAR_SRW(1) | // Status Register Write
349  RTC_WAR_CRW(1) | // Control Register Write
350  RTC_WAR_TCRW(1) | // Time Compensation Register Write
351  RTC_WAR_TARW(1) | // Time Alarm Register Write
352  RTC_WAR_TPRW(1) | // Time Prescaler Register Write
353  RTC_WAR_TSRW(1); // Time Seconds Register Write
354  #endif
355 
356  #if defined(RTC_RAR_TSRR)
357  //! RTC Read Access Register
358  static constexpr uint32_t rar =
359  RTC_RAR_IERR(1) | // Interrupt Enable Register Read
360  RTC_RAR_LRR(1) | // Lock Register Read
361  RTC_RAR_SRR(1) | // Status Register Read
362  RTC_RAR_CRR(1) | // Control Register Read
363  RTC_RAR_TCRR(1) | // Time Compensation Register Read
364  RTC_RAR_TARR(1) | // Time Alarm Register Read
365  RTC_RAR_TPRR(1) | // Time Prescaler Register Read
366  RTC_RAR_TSRR(1); // Time Seconds Register Read
367  #endif
368 
369  //! IRQ numbers for hardware
370  static constexpr IRQn_Type irqNums[] = RTC_IRQS;
371 
372  //! Number of IRQs for hardware
373  static constexpr uint32_t irqCount = sizeof(irqNums)/sizeof(irqNums[0]);
374 
375  //! Class based callback handler has been installed in vector table
376  static constexpr bool irqAlarmHandlerInstalled = 0;
377 
378  //! Class based callback handler has been installed in vector table
379  static constexpr bool irqSecondsHandlerInstalled = 0;
380 
381  //! Default IRQ level
382  static constexpr uint32_t irqLevel = 8;
383 
384  //! Time for cold start (corrected for 12 leap years since 1970)
385  static constexpr uint32_t coldStartTime =
386  ((((2019-1970)*365UL +
387  (181) +
388  (1+12-1))*24 +
389  (12))*60 +
390  (0))*60;
391 
392  /**
393  * Enable clock to Rtc
394  */
395  static void enableClock() {
396 #ifdef PCC
397  PccInfo::enableRtcClock();
398 #else
399  SIM->SCGC6 |= SIM_SCGC6_RTC_MASK;
400 #endif
401  }
402 
403  /**
404  * Disable clock to Rtc
405  */
406  static void disableClock() {
407 #ifdef PCC
408  PccInfo::disableRtcClock();
409 #else
410  SIM->SCGC6 &= ~SIM_SCGC6_RTC_MASK;
411 #endif
412  }
413 
414  /**
415  * Get RTC clock frequency (internal, not masked by RTC_CR_CLKO)
416  *
417  * @return Clock frequency as uint32_t
418  */
419  static uint32_t getInternalClock() {
420  // RTC uses EXTAL32/XTAL32 clock
421  return (rtc().CR&RTC_CR_OSCE_MASK)?osc_input_freq:0;
422  }
423 
424  /**
425  * Get RTC clock frequency (external, masked by RTC_CR_CLKO)
426  *
427  * @return Clock frequency as uint32_t
428  */
429  static uint32_t getExternalClock() {
430  return (rtc().CR&RTC_CR_CLKO_MASK)?0:getInternalClock();
431  }
432 
433  //! Number of signals available in info table
434  static constexpr int numSignals = 3;
435 
436  //! Information for each signal of peripheral
437  static constexpr PinInfo info[] = {
438 
439  // Signal Pin portInfo gpioAddress gpioBit PCR value
440  /* 0: XTAL32 = XTAL32 (XTAL32) */ { NoPortInfo, 0, FIXED_NO_PCR, 0 },
441  /* 1: EXTAL32 = EXTAL32 (EXTAL32) */ { NoPortInfo, 0, FIXED_NO_PCR, 0 },
442  /* 2: RTC_CLKOUT = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
443  };
444 
445  /**
446  * Initialise pins used by peripheral
447  *
448  * @param pcrValue PCR value controlling pin options
449  */
450  static void initPCRs(uint32_t pcrValue=defaultPcrValue) {
451  (void)pcrValue;
452  }
453 
454  /**
455  * Resets pins used by peripheral
456  */
457  static void clearPCRs() {
458  }
459 
460 };
461 
462 /**
463  * End group RTC_Group
464  * @}
465  */
466 /**
467  * @addtogroup MCG_Group MCG, Multipurpose Clock Generator
468  * @brief Abstraction for Multipurpose Clock Generator
469  * @{
470  */
471 #define USBDM_MCG_IS_DEFINED
472 /**
473  * Peripheral information for MCG, Multipurpose Clock Generator.
474  *
475  * This may include pin information, constants, register addresses, and default register values,
476  * along with simple accessor functions.
477  */
478 class McgInfo {
479 public:
480  // Template:mcg_mk
481 
482  //! Hardware base address as uint32_t
483  static constexpr uint32_t baseAddress = MCG_BasePtr;
484 
485  //! Hardware base pointer
486  __attribute__((always_inline)) static volatile MCG_Type &mcg() {
487  return *(MCG_Type *)baseAddress;
488  }
489 
490  //! IRQ numbers for hardware
491  static constexpr IRQn_Type irqNums[] = MCG_IRQS;
492 
493  //! Number of IRQs for hardware
494  static constexpr uint32_t irqCount = sizeof(irqNums)/sizeof(irqNums[0]);
495 
496  //! Class based callback handler has been installed in vector table
497  static constexpr bool irqHandlerInstalled = 0;
498 
499  //! Default IRQ level
500  static constexpr uint32_t irqLevel = 8;
501 
502  //! Indicates need for special handling of CLKDIV1 register
503  static constexpr int ERRATA_E2448 = 0;
504 
505  enum ClockMode {
506  ClockMode_None = -1,
507  ClockMode_FEI = 0,
508  ClockMode_FEE,
509  ClockMode_FBI,
510  ClockMode_BLPI,
511  ClockMode_FBE,
512  ClockMode_BLPE,
513  ClockMode_PBE,
514  ClockMode_PEE,
515  };
516 
517  //! Frequency of Slow Internal Reference Clock [~32kHz]
518  static constexpr uint32_t system_slow_irc_clock = 32768UL;
519 
520  //! Frequency of Fast Internal Reference Clock [~4MHz]
521  static constexpr uint32_t system_fast_irc_clock = 4000000UL;
522 
523  //! PLL VDIV min value
524  static constexpr uint32_t pll_vdiv_min = 24;
525 
526  //! PLL post divider
527  static constexpr uint32_t pll_post_divider = 1;
528 
529  //! Structure for clock configurations
530  struct ClockInfo {
531  //! System Clock Divider Register 1
532  const uint32_t clkdiv1;
533 
534  #ifdef SIM_CLKDIV3_PLLFLLDIV
535  //! PLLFLL clock divider divisor & fraction
536  const uint32_t clkdiv3;
537  #endif
538 
539  //! SIM SOPT2 - Clock selectors for various peripherals
540  const uint32_t sopt2;
541 
542  //! Clock Mode
543  const ClockMode clockMode:8;
544 
545  //! Control Register 1 - FRDIV, IRCLKEN, IREFSTEN, (-CLKS, -IREFS)
546  const uint8_t c1;
547  //! Control Register 2 - LOCRE0, RANGE0, HGO0, EREFS0, IRCS, (-LP)
548  const uint8_t c2;
549  //! Control Register 4 - DMX32, DRST_DRS
550  const uint8_t c4;
551  //! Control Register 5 - PLLCLKEN0, PLLSTEN0, PRDIV0
552  const uint8_t c5;
553  //! Control Register 6 - LOLIE0, CME0, VDIV0, (-PLLS)
554  const uint8_t c6;
555  //! Status and Control Register - FCRDIV
556  const uint8_t sc;
557  //! Control Register 7 - OSCSEL
558  const uint8_t c7;
559  //! Control Register 8 - LOCRE1, LOLRE, CME1
560  const uint8_t c8;
561  };
562 
563  /**
564  * Get MCGERCLK
565  *
566  * @return MCGERCLK as uint32_t
567  */
568  static uint32_t getErcClock() {
569 
570  switch((mcg().C7&MCG_C7_OSCSEL_MASK)) {
571  default : return 0;
572  case MCG_C7_OSCSEL(0) : return Osc0Info::getOscClock();
573  case MCG_C7_OSCSEL(1) : return RtcInfo::getInternalClock();
574  }
575  }
576 
577  /**
578  * Get Internal MCGIRCLK (ungated by MCG_C1_IRCLKEN_MASK)
579  *
580  * @return MCGIRCLK as uint32_t
581  */
582  static uint32_t getInternalIrcClock() {
583  if (mcg().C2&MCG_C2_IRCS_MASK) {
584  #ifdef MCG_SC_FCRDIV_MASK
585  return (system_fast_irc_clock/(1<<((mcg().SC&MCG_SC_FCRDIV_MASK)>>MCG_SC_FCRDIV_SHIFT)));
586  #else
587  return system_fast_irc_clock;
588  #endif
589  }
590  else {
591  return system_slow_irc_clock;
592  }
593  }
594 
595  /**
596  * Get MCGIRCLK (gated by MCG_C1_IRCLKEN_MASK)
597  *
598  * @return MCGIRCLK as uint32_t
599  */
600  static uint32_t getMcgIrClock() {
601  if (mcg().C1&MCG_C1_IRCLKEN_MASK) {
602  return getInternalIrcClock();
603  }
604  else {
605  return 0;
606  }
607  }
608 
609 };
610 
611 /**
612  * End group MCG_Group
613  * @}
614  */
615 /**
616  * @addtogroup SIM_Group SIM, System Integration Module
617  * @brief Abstraction for System Integration Module
618  * @{
619  */
620 #define USBDM_SIM_IS_DEFINED
621 /**
622  * Peripheral information for SIM, System Integration Module.
623  *
624  * This may include pin information, constants, register addresses, and default register values,
625  * along with simple accessor functions.
626  */
627  /**
628  * RAM size
629  */
630  enum SimRamSize {
631  SimRamSize_8KiB = SIM_SOPT1_RAMSIZE(1), //!< 8KiB RAM
632  SimRamSize_16KiB = SIM_SOPT1_RAMSIZE(3), //!< 16KiB RAM
633  SimRamSize_24KiB = SIM_SOPT1_RAMSIZE(4), //!< 24KiB RAM
634  SimRamSize_32KiB = SIM_SOPT1_RAMSIZE(5), //!< 32KiB RAM
635  SimRamSize_64KiB = SIM_SOPT1_RAMSIZE(7), //!< 64KiB RAM
636  SimRamSize_96KiB = SIM_SOPT1_RAMSIZE(8), //!< 96KiB RAM
637  SimRamSize_128KiB = SIM_SOPT1_RAMSIZE(9), //!< 128KiB RAM
638  SimRamSize_256KiB = SIM_SOPT1_RAMSIZE(11), //!< 256KiB RAM
639  };
640 
641  /**
642  * Selects the ERCLK32K clock source
643  */
644  enum SimOsc32kSel {
645  SimOsc32kSel_Osc32kClk = SIM_SOPT1_OSC32KSEL(0), //!< OSC0 operating as 32K oscillator
646  SimOsc32kSel_Rtc32kClk = SIM_SOPT1_OSC32KSEL(2), //!< Rtc32k clock
647  SimOsc32kSel_LpoClk = SIM_SOPT1_OSC32KSEL(3), //!< LPO Clock
648  };
649 
650 
651  /**
652  * USB full-speed clock sources
653  */
654  enum SimUsbFullSpeedClockSource {
655  SimUsbFullSpeedClockSource_External = SIM_SOPT2_USBSRC(0), //!< External bypass clock (USB_CLKIN)
656  SimUsbFullSpeedClockSource_Peripheral = SIM_SOPT2_USBSRC(1), //!< Peripheral clock selected by SIM.SOPT2[PLLFLLSEL] divided by SIM.CLKDIV2
657  };
658 
659  /**
660  * Peripheral Clock sources
661  */
662  enum SimPeripheralClockSource {
663  SimPeripheralClockSource_McgFll = SIM_SOPT2_PLLFLLSEL(0), //!< MCG FLL Clock
664  SimPeripheralClockSource_McgPll = SIM_SOPT2_PLLFLLSEL(1), //!< MCG PLL Clock
665  #ifdef USB_CLK_RECOVER_IRC_EN_REG_EN_MASK
666  SimPeripheralClockSource_Irc48m = SIM_SOPT2_PLLFLLSEL(3), //!< IRC 48MHz clock
667  #endif
668  };
669 
670  /**
671  * Debug trace clock select.
672  *
673  * Selects the trace clock source.
674  */
675  enum SimTraceClockoutSel {
676  SimTraceClockoutSel_McgClkout = SIM_SOPT2_TRACECLKSEL(0), //!< MCG output clock (MCGOUTCLK)
677  SimTraceClockoutSel_CoreClk = SIM_SOPT2_TRACECLKSEL(1), //!< Core/system clock
678  };
679 
680  /**
681  * Selects the clock to output on the CLKOUT pin.
682  */
683  enum SimClkoutSel {
684  SimClkoutSel_FlexBus = SIM_SOPT2_CLKOUTSEL(0), //!< FlexBus
685  SimClkoutSel_Reserved1 = SIM_SOPT2_CLKOUTSEL(1), //!<
686  SimClkoutSel_Flash = SIM_SOPT2_CLKOUTSEL(2), //!< Flash
687  SimClkoutSel_Lpo = SIM_SOPT2_CLKOUTSEL(3), //!< LPO (1kHz)
688  SimClkoutSel_McgirClk = SIM_SOPT2_CLKOUTSEL(4), //!< McgirClk
689  SimClkoutSel_RTC = SIM_SOPT2_CLKOUTSEL(5), //!< RTC 32.768kHz
690  SimClkoutSel_OscerClk0 = SIM_SOPT2_CLKOUTSEL(6), //!< OscerClk0
691  SimClkoutSel_Reserved7 = SIM_SOPT2_CLKOUTSEL(7), //!<
692  };
693 
694  /**
695  * RTC clock out select
696  * Selects the clock to be output on the RTC_CLKOUT pin.
697  */
698  enum RtcClkoutSel {
699  RtcClkoutSel_1Hz = SIM_SOPT2_RTCCLKOUTSEL(0),//!< RTC 1 Hz clock is output on the RTC_CLKOUT pin.
700  RtcClkoutSel_32kHz = SIM_SOPT2_RTCCLKOUTSEL(1),//!< RTC 32.768kHz clock is output on the RTC_CLKOUT pin.
701  };
702 
703  /**
704  * FlexTimer 0 Hardware Trigger 0 Source Select
705  */
706  enum SimFtm0Trg0Src {
707  SimFtm0Trg0Src_Cmp0 = SIM_SOPT4_FTM0TRG0SRC(0),//!< Cmp0 output
708  SimFtm0Trg0Src_Ftm1 = SIM_SOPT4_FTM0TRG0SRC(1),//!< Ftm1 channel match
709  };
710 
711  /**
712  * FTM1 External Clock Pin Select
713  *
714  * Selects the external pin used to drive the clock to the FTM1 module.
715  * NOTE: The selected pin must also be configured for the FTM external clock function through the
716  * appropriate pin control register in the port control module.
717  */
718  enum SimFtm1ClkSel {
719  SimFtm1ClkSel_FtmClk0 = SIM_SOPT4_FTM1CLKSEL(0),//!< FtmClk0 pin
720  SimFtm1ClkSel_FtmClk1 = SIM_SOPT4_FTM1CLKSEL(1),//!< FtmClk1 pin
721  };
722 
723  /**
724  * FlexTimer 0 External Clock Pin Select
725  *
726  * Selects the external pin used to drive the clock to the FTM0 module.
727  * NOTE: The selected pin must also be configured for the FTM external clock function through the
728  * appropriate pin control register in the port control module.
729  */
730  enum SimFtm0ClkSel {
731  SimFtm0ClkSel_FtmClk0 = SIM_SOPT4_FTM0CLKSEL(0),//!< FtmClk0 pin
732  SimFtm0ClkSel_FtmClk1 = SIM_SOPT4_FTM0CLKSEL(1),//!< FtmClk1 pin
733  };
734 
735  /**
736  * FTM1 channel 0 input capture source select
737  *
738  * Selects the source for FTM1 channel 0 input capture.
739  * NOTE: When the FTM is not in input capture mode, clear this field.
740  */
741  enum SimFtm1Ch0Src {
742  SimFtm1Ch0Src_Ftm1Ch0 = SIM_SOPT4_FTM1CH0SRC(0),//!< Ftm1Ch0
743  SimFtm1Ch0Src_Cmp0 = SIM_SOPT4_FTM1CH0SRC(1),//!< Cmp0 output
744  SimFtm1Ch0Src_Cmp1 = SIM_SOPT4_FTM1CH0SRC(2),//!< Cmp1 output
745  SimFtm1Ch0Src_UsbSof = SIM_SOPT4_FTM1CH0SRC(3),//!< USB SOF
746  };
747 
748  /**
749  * FTM1 Fault 0 Select
750  *
751  * Selects the source of FTM1 fault 0.
752  * NOTE: The pin source for fault 0 must be configured for the FTM module fault function through the
753  * appropriate pin control register in the port control module.
754  */
755  enum SimFtm1Flt0 {
756  SimFtm1Flt0_Ftm1Flt0 = SIM_SOPT4_FTM1FLT0(0),//!< FTM1 Fault 0 pin
757  SimFtm1Flt0_Cmp0 = SIM_SOPT4_FTM1FLT0(1),//!< Cmp0 output
758  };
759 
760  /**
761  * FTM0 Fault 1 Select
762  *
763  * Selects the source of FTM0 fault 1.
764  * NOTE: The pin source for fault 1 must be configured for the FTM module fault function through the
765  * appropriate pin control register in the port control module.
766  */
767  enum SimFtm0Flt1 {
768  SimFtm0Flt1_Ftm0Flt1 = SIM_SOPT4_FTM0FLT1(0),//!< FTM0 Fault 1 pin
769  SimFtm0Flt1_Cmp1 = SIM_SOPT4_FTM0FLT1(1),//!< Cmp1 output
770  };
771 
772  /**
773  * FTM0 Fault 0 Select
774  *
775  * Selects the source of FTM0 fault 0.
776  * NOTE: The pin source for fault 0 must be configured for the FTM module fault function through the
777  * appropriate pin control register in the port control module.
778  */
779  enum SimFtm0Flt0 {
780  SimFtm0Flt0_Ftm0Flt0 = SIM_SOPT4_FTM0FLT0(0),//!< FTM0 Fault 0 pin
781  SimFtm0Flt0_Cmp0 = SIM_SOPT4_FTM0FLT0(1),//!< Cmp0 output
782  };
783 
784  /**
785  * UART 1 receive data source select
786  *
787  * Selects the source for the UART 1 receive data.
788  */
789  enum SimUart1RxSrc {
790  SimUart1RxSrc_Uart1Rx = SIM_SOPT5_UART1RXSRC(0),//!< Uart1 Rx direct
791  SimUart1RxSrc_Cmp0 = SIM_SOPT5_UART1RXSRC(1),//!< Cmp0 output
792  SimUart1RxSrc_Cmp1 = SIM_SOPT5_UART1RXSRC(2),//!< Cmp1 output
793  SimUart1RxSrc_Reserved3 = SIM_SOPT5_UART1RXSRC(3),//!< Reserved
794  };
795 
796  /**
797  * UART 1 transmit data source select
798  *
799  * Selects the source for the UART 1 transmit data.
800  */
801  enum SimUart1TxSrc {
802  SimUart1TxSrc_Direct = SIM_SOPT5_UART1TXSRC(0),//!< Uart1 Tx Direct
803  SimUart1TxSrc_ModulatedbyFtm1Ch0 = SIM_SOPT5_UART1TXSRC(1),//!< Uart1 Tx Modulated by Ftm1 Ch0
804  };
805 
806  /**
807  * UART 0 receive data source select
808  *
809  * Selects the source for the UART 0 receive data.
810  */
811  enum SimUart0RxSrc {
812  SimUart0RxSrc_Uart0Rx = SIM_SOPT5_UART0RXSRC(0),//!< Uart0 Rx direct
813  SimUart0RxSrc_Cmp0 = SIM_SOPT5_UART0RXSRC(1),//!< Cmp0 output
814  SimUart0RxSrc_Cmp1 = SIM_SOPT5_UART0RXSRC(2),//!< Cmp1 output
815  SimUart0RxSrc_Reserved3 = SIM_SOPT5_UART0RXSRC(3),//!< Reserved
816  };
817 
818  /**
819  * UART 0 transmit data source select
820  *
821  * Selects the source for the UART 0 transmit data.
822  */
823  enum SimUart0TxSrc {
824  SimUart0TxSrc_Direct = SIM_SOPT5_UART0TXSRC(0),//!< Uart0 Tx Direct
825  SimUart0TxSrc_ModulatedbyFtm1Ch0 = SIM_SOPT5_UART0TXSRC(1),//!< Uart0 Tx Modulated by Ftm1 Ch0
826  };
827 
828  /**
829  * Selects the ADC0 Trigger source in STOP and VLPS modes, or when ADC0 Alternative Trigger is active.
830  */
831  enum SimAdc0Trigger {
832  SimAdc0Trigger_PdbExTrig = SIM_SOPT7_ADC0TRGSEL(0), //!< External Trigger Source PDBx_EXTRG
833  SimAdc0Trigger_Cmp0 = SIM_SOPT7_ADC0TRGSEL(1), //!< Comparator 0
834  SimAdc0Trigger_Cmp1 = SIM_SOPT7_ADC0TRGSEL(2), //!< Comparator 1
835  SimAdc0Trigger_Cmp2 = SIM_SOPT7_ADC0TRGSEL(3), //!< Comparator 2 (if present)
836  SimAdc0Trigger_PitCh0 = SIM_SOPT7_ADC0TRGSEL(4), //!< PIT Channel 0
837  SimAdc0Trigger_PitCh1 = SIM_SOPT7_ADC0TRGSEL(5), //!< PIT Channel 1
838  SimAdc0Trigger_PitCh2 = SIM_SOPT7_ADC0TRGSEL(6), //!< PIT Channel 2
839  SimAdc0Trigger_PitCh3 = SIM_SOPT7_ADC0TRGSEL(7), //!< PIT Channel 3
840  SimAdc0Trigger_Ftm0 = SIM_SOPT7_ADC0TRGSEL(8), //!< FTM0 Init and Ext Trigger Outputs
841  SimAdc0Trigger_Ftm1 = SIM_SOPT7_ADC0TRGSEL(9), //!< FTM1 Init and Ext Trigger Outputs
842  SimAdc0Trigger_Ftm2 = SIM_SOPT7_ADC0TRGSEL(10), //!< FTM2 Init and Ext Trigger Outputs (if present)
843  SimAdc0Trigger_Ftm3 = SIM_SOPT7_ADC0TRGSEL(11), //!< FTM3 Init and Ext Trigger Outputs (if present)
844  SimAdc0Trigger_RtcAlarm = SIM_SOPT7_ADC0TRGSEL(12), //!< RTC Alarm
845  SimAdc0Trigger_RtcSeconds = SIM_SOPT7_ADC0TRGSEL(13), //!< RTC Seconds
846  SimAdc0Trigger_Lptrm = SIM_SOPT7_ADC0TRGSEL(14), //!< LPTMR
847  SimAdc0Trigger_15 = SIM_SOPT7_ADC0TRGSEL(15), //!< Reserved
848  };
849 
850  /**
851  * Selects the ADC0 trigger mode.
852  *
853  * _Pdb - ADC is triggered by PDB which selects the pretrigger (SC1[0..n]/R[0..n]
854  * _Alt_PreTrigger_0 - ADC is triggered by SimAdc0Trigger selection and uses pretrigger 0 = A (SC1[0]/R[0])
855  * _Alt_PreTrigger_1 - ADC is triggered by SimAdc0Trigger selection and uses pretrigger 1 = B (SC1[1]/R[1])
856  */
857  enum SimAdc0TriggerMode {
858  SimAdc0TriggerMode_Pdb = SIM_SOPT7_ADC0ALTTRGEN(0), //!< PDB trigger
859  SimAdc0TriggerMode_Alt_PreTrigger_0 = SIM_SOPT7_ADC0ALTTRGEN(1)|SIM_SOPT7_ADC0PRETRGSEL(0), //!< Pre-trigger 0 = A (SC1[0])
860  SimAdc0TriggerMode_Alt_PreTrigger_1 = SIM_SOPT7_ADC0ALTTRGEN(1)|SIM_SOPT7_ADC0PRETRGSEL(1), //!< Pre-trigger 1 = B (SC1[1])
861  };
862 
863 class SimInfo {
864 public:
865  // Template:sim_mk20d5
866 
867  //! Hardware base address as uint32_t
868  static constexpr uint32_t baseAddress = SIM_BasePtr;
869 
870  //! Hardware base pointer
871  __attribute__((always_inline)) static volatile SIM_Type &sim() {
872  return *(SIM_Type *)baseAddress;
873  }
874 
875  /**
876  * Get RAM size
877  *
878  * @return RAM size value
879  */
880  static SimRamSize getRamSize() {
881 
882  return static_cast<SimRamSize>(sim().SOPT1&SIM_SOPT1_RAMSIZE_MASK);
883  }
884 
885  /**
886  * Get ERCLK32K clock frequency
887  *
888  * @return Clock frequency as a uint32_t in Hz
889  */
890  static uint32_t getErc32kClock() {
891 
892  switch(sim().SOPT1&SIM_SOPT1_OSC32KSEL_MASK) {
893  default : return 0;
894  case SimOsc32kSel_Osc32kClk : return Osc0Info::getOsc32kClock();
895  case SimOsc32kSel_Rtc32kClk : return RtcInfo::getExternalClock();
896  case SimOsc32kSel_LpoClk : return 1000;
897  }
898  }
899 
900  /**
901  * Set ERCLK32K clock source
902  *
903  * @param simOsc32kSel Clock source
904  */
905  static void setErc32kClock(SimOsc32kSel simOsc32kSel) {
906  sim().SOPT1 = (sim().SOPT1&~SIM_SOPT1_OSC32KSEL_MASK) | simOsc32kSel;
907  }
908 
909  //! System Options Register 1
910  static constexpr uint32_t sopt1 =
911  #ifdef SIM_SOPT1_OSC32KOUT
912  SIM_SOPT1_OSC32KOUT(-1) | // 32K oscillator clock out pin select
913  #endif
914  SIM_SOPT1_OSC32KSEL(2); // 32K oscillator clock select
915 
916  /**
917  * Selects the clock to output on the CLKOUT pin.
918  *
919  * @param simClkoutSel
920  */
921  static void setClkout(SimClkoutSel simClkoutSel) {
922  sim().SOPT2 = (sim().SOPT2&~SIM_SOPT2_CLKOUTSEL_MASK) | simClkoutSel;
923  }
924 
925  /**
926  * Set Peripheral clock source
927  *
928  * @param simPeripheralClockSource Clock source for peripheral clock
929  */
930  static void setPeripheralClock(SimPeripheralClockSource simPeripheralClockSource) {
931  sim().SOPT2 = (sim().SOPT2&~SIM_SOPT2_PLLFLLSEL_MASK) | simPeripheralClockSource;
932  }
933 
934  /**
935  * Get Peripheral clock frequency
936  *
937  * @return Frequency as a uint32_t in Hz
938  */
939  static uint32_t getPeripheralClock() {
940 
941  switch(sim().SOPT2&SIM_SOPT2_PLLFLLSEL_MASK) {
942  default: return 0;
943  case SimPeripheralClockSource_McgFll : return SystemMcgFllClock;
944  case SimPeripheralClockSource_McgPll : return SystemMcgPllClock;
945  }
946  }
947 
948  /**
949  * Get UART0 input clock frequency
950  *
951  * @return Clock frequency in Hz
952  */
953  static inline uint32_t getUart0Clock() {
954  return SystemCoreClock;
955  }
956 
957  /**
958  * Get UART1 input clock frequency
959  *
960  * @return Clock frequency in Hz
961  */
962  static inline uint32_t getUart1Clock() {
963  return SystemCoreClock;
964  }
965 
966  /**
967  * Get UART2 input clock frequency
968  *
969  * @return Clock frequency in Hz
970  */
971  static inline uint32_t getUart2Clock() {
972  return SystemBusClock;
973  }
974 
975  #ifdef SIM_SOPT2_USBSRC_MASK
976  /**
977  * Set USB Full-speed clock source
978  *
979  * @param simUsbFullSpeedClockSource Clock source for peripheral clock
980  */
981  static void setUsbFullSpeedClock(SimUsbFullSpeedClockSource simUsbFullSpeedClockSource) {
982  sim().SOPT2 = (sim().SOPT2&~SIM_SOPT2_USBSRC_MASK) | simUsbFullSpeedClockSource;
983  }
984 
985  /**
986  * Get USB clock frequency
987  *
988  * @return Clock frequency as a uint32_t in Hz
989  */
990  static uint32_t getUsbClock() {
991  switch ((sim().SOPT2&SIM_SOPT2_USBSRC_MASK)) {
992  default:
993  case SimUsbFullSpeedClockSource_External : return 48000000;
994  case SimUsbFullSpeedClockSource_Peripheral : return (getPeripheralClock()*
995  (((sim().CLKDIV2&SIM_CLKDIV2_USBFRAC_MASK)>>SIM_CLKDIV2_USBFRAC_SHIFT)+1))/
996  (((sim().CLKDIV2&SIM_CLKDIV2_USBDIV_MASK)>>SIM_CLKDIV2_USBDIV_SHIFT)+1);
997  }
998  }
999  #endif
1000 
1001  //! System Options Register 2
1002  static constexpr uint32_t sopt2 =
1003  #ifdef SIM_SOPT2_TRACECLKSEL
1004  SIM_SOPT2_TRACECLKSEL(0) | // Debug trace clock select
1005  #endif
1006  #ifdef SIM_SOPT2_TIMESRC
1007  SIM_SOPT2_TIMESRC(-1) | // IEEE 1588 timestamp clock source select
1008  #endif
1009  #ifdef SIM_SOPT2_RMIISRC
1010  SIM_SOPT2_RMIISRC(-1) | // Ethernet RMII clock source select
1011  #endif
1012  #ifdef SIM_SOPT2_SDHCSRC
1013  SIM_SOPT2_SDHCSRC(-1) | // SDHC clock source select
1014  #endif
1015  #ifdef SIM_SOPT2_UART0SRC
1016  SIM_SOPT2_UART0SRC(-1) | // UART0 clock source select
1017  #endif
1018  #ifdef SIM_SOPT2_LPUARTSRC
1019  SIM_SOPT2_LPUARTSRC(-1) | // LPUART clock source select
1020  #endif
1021  #ifdef SIM_SOPT2_LPUART0SRC
1022  SIM_SOPT2_LPUART0SRC(-1) | // LPUART clock source select
1023  #endif
1024  #ifdef SIM_SOPT2_PTD7PAD
1025  SIM_SOPT2_PTD7PAD(0) | // PTD7 pad drive strength
1026  #endif
1027  #ifdef SIM_SOPT2_TPMSRC
1028  SIM_SOPT2_TPMSRC(-1) | // TPM clock source select
1029  #endif
1030  #ifdef SIM_SOPT2_USBSRC
1031  SIM_SOPT2_USBSRC(1) | // USB clock source select
1032  #endif
1033  #ifdef SIM_SOPT2_FBSL
1034  SIM_SOPT2_FBSL(-1) | // FlexBus security level
1035  #endif
1036  #ifdef SIM_SOPT2_PLLFLLSEL
1037  SIM_SOPT2_PLLFLLSEL(1)| // PLL/FLL clock select
1038  #endif
1039  #ifdef SIM_SOPT2_RTCCLKOUTSEL
1040  SIM_SOPT2_RTCCLKOUTSEL(1) | // RTC clock out select
1041  #endif
1042  SIM_SOPT2_CLKOUTSEL(2); // CLKOUT pin clock source select
1043 
1044  //! System Options Register 4
1045  static constexpr uint32_t sopt4 =
1046  #ifdef SIM_SOPT4_FTM3TRG1SRC
1047  SIM_SOPT4_FTM3TRG1SRC(-1) | // FlexTimer 3 Hardware Trigger 1 Source Select
1048  #endif
1049  #ifdef SIM_SOPT4_FTM3TRG0SRC
1050  SIM_SOPT4_FTM3TRG0SRC(-1) | // FlexTimer 3 Hardware Trigger 0 Source Select
1051  #endif
1052  #ifdef SIM_SOPT4_FTM0TRG1SRC
1053  SIM_SOPT4_FTM0TRG1SRC(-1) | // FlexTimer 0 Hardware Trigger 1 Source Select
1054  #endif
1055  #ifdef SIM_SOPT4_FTM0TRG0SRC
1056  SIM_SOPT4_FTM0TRG0SRC(0) | // FlexTimer 0 Hardware Trigger 0 Source Select
1057  #endif
1058  #ifdef SIM_SOPT4_FTM3CLKSEL
1059  SIM_SOPT4_FTM3CLKSEL(-1) | // FlexTimer 3 External Clock Pin Select
1060  #endif
1061  #ifdef SIM_SOPT4_FTM2CLKSEL
1062  SIM_SOPT4_FTM2CLKSEL(-1) | // FlexTimer 2 External Clock Pin Select
1063  #endif
1064  #ifdef SIM_SOPT4_FTM1CLKSEL
1065  SIM_SOPT4_FTM1CLKSEL(0) | // FlexTimer 1 External Clock Pin Select
1066  #endif
1067  #ifdef SIM_SOPT4_FTM0CLKSEL
1068  SIM_SOPT4_FTM0CLKSEL(0) | // FlexTimer 0 External Clock Pin Select
1069  #endif
1070  #ifdef SIM_SOPT4_FTM2CH1SRC
1071  SIM_SOPT4_FTM2CH1SRC(-1) | // FTM2 channel 1 input capture source select
1072  #endif
1073  #ifdef SIM_SOPT4_FTM2CH0SRC
1074  SIM_SOPT4_FTM2CH0SRC(-1) | // FTM2 channel 0 input capture source select
1075  #endif
1076  #ifdef SIM_SOPT4_FTM1CH0SRC
1077  SIM_SOPT4_FTM1CH0SRC(0) | // FTM1 channel 0 input capture source select
1078  #endif
1079  #ifdef SIM_SOPT4_FTM3FLT0
1080  SIM_SOPT4_FTM3FLT0(-1) | // FlexTimer 3 Fault 0 Select
1081  #endif
1082  #ifdef SIM_SOPT4_FTM2FLT0
1083  SIM_SOPT4_FTM2FLT0(-1) | // FlexTimer 2 Fault 0 Select
1084  #endif
1085  #ifdef SIM_SOPT4_FTM1FLT0
1086  SIM_SOPT4_FTM1FLT0(0) | // FlexTimer 1 Fault 0 Select
1087  #endif
1088  #ifdef SIM_SOPT4_FTM0FLT3
1089  SIM_SOPT4_FTM0FLT3(-1) | // FlexTimer 0 Fault 3 Select
1090  #endif
1091  #ifdef SIM_SOPT4_FTM0FLT2
1092  SIM_SOPT4_FTM0FLT2(-1) | // FlexTimer 0 Fault 2 Select
1093  #endif
1094  SIM_SOPT4_FTM0FLT1(0) | // FlexTimer 0 Fault 1 Select
1095  SIM_SOPT4_FTM0FLT0(0); // FlexTimer 0 Fault 0 Select
1096 
1097  /**
1098  * Select FlexTimer 0 Hardware Trigger 0 Source
1099  *
1100  * @param simFtm0Trg0Src Trigger Source
1101  */
1102  static void setFtm0Trg0Src(SimFtm0Trg0Src simFtm0Trg0Src) {
1103  sim().SOPT4 = (sim().SOPT4&~SIM_SOPT4_FTM0TRG0SRC_MASK)|simFtm0Trg0Src;
1104  }
1105 
1106  /**
1107  * Select FlexTimer 1 External Clock Pin
1108  *
1109  * @param simFtm1ClkSel Clock Pin
1110  */
1111  static void setFtm1ClkSel(SimFtm1ClkSel simFtm1ClkSel) {
1112  sim().SOPT4 = (sim().SOPT4&~SIM_SOPT4_FTM1CLKSEL_MASK)|simFtm1ClkSel;
1113  }
1114 
1115  /**
1116  * Select FTM0 External Clock Pin
1117  *
1118  * @param simFtm0ClkSel Clock Pin
1119  */
1120  static void setFtm0ClkSel(SimFtm0ClkSel simFtm0ClkSel) {
1121  sim().SOPT4 = (sim().SOPT4&~SIM_SOPT4_FTM0CLKSEL_MASK)|simFtm0ClkSel;
1122  }
1123 
1124  /**
1125  * Select FTM1 channel 0 input capture source
1126  *
1127  * @param simFtm1Ch0Src Capture Source
1128  */
1129  static void setFtm1Ch0Src(SimFtm1Ch0Src simFtm1Ch0Src) {
1130  sim().SOPT4 = (sim().SOPT4&~SIM_SOPT4_FTM1CH0SRC_MASK)|simFtm1Ch0Src;
1131  }
1132 
1133  /**
1134  * Select FTM1 Fault 0 Select
1135  *
1136  * @param simFtm1Flt0 Fault Source
1137  */
1138  static void setFtm1Flt0(SimFtm1Flt0 simFtm1Flt0) {
1139  sim().SOPT4 = (sim().SOPT4&~SIM_SOPT4_FTM1FLT0_MASK)|simFtm1Flt0;
1140  }
1141 
1142  /**
1143  * Select FTM0 Fault 1 Select
1144  *
1145  * @param simFtm0Flt1 Fault Source
1146  */
1147  static void setFtm0Flt1(SimFtm0Flt1 simFtm0Flt1) {
1148  sim().SOPT4 = (sim().SOPT4&~SIM_SOPT4_FTM0FLT1_MASK)|simFtm0Flt1;
1149  }
1150 
1151  /**
1152  * Select FTM0 Fault 0 Select
1153  *
1154  * @param simFtm0Flt0 Fault Source
1155  */
1156  static void setFtm0Flt0(SimFtm0Flt0 simFtm0Flt0) {
1157  sim().SOPT4 = (sim().SOPT4&~SIM_SOPT4_FTM0FLT0_MASK)|simFtm0Flt0;
1158  }
1159 
1160  /**
1161  * Select UART 1 receive data source
1162  *
1163  * @param simUart1RxSrc UART Rx source
1164  */
1165  static void setUart1RxSrc(SimUart1RxSrc simUart1RxSrc) {
1166  sim().SOPT5 = (sim().SOPT5&~SIM_SOPT5_UART1RXSRC_MASK)|simUart1RxSrc;
1167  }
1168 
1169  /**
1170  * Select UART 1 transmit data source select
1171  *
1172  * @param simUart1TxSrc UART Tx source
1173  */
1174  static void setUart1TxSrc(SimUart1TxSrc simUart1TxSrc) {
1175  sim().SOPT5 = (sim().SOPT5&~SIM_SOPT5_UART1TXSRC_MASK)|simUart1TxSrc;
1176  }
1177 
1178  /**
1179  * Select UART 0 receive data source
1180  *
1181  * @param simUart0RxSrc UART Rx source
1182  */
1183  static void setUart0RxSrc(SimUart0RxSrc simUart0RxSrc) {
1184  sim().SOPT5 = (sim().SOPT5&~SIM_SOPT5_UART0RXSRC_MASK)|simUart0RxSrc;
1185  }
1186 
1187  /**
1188  * Select UART 0 transmit data source select
1189  *
1190  * @param simUart0TxSrc UART Tx source
1191  */
1192  static void setUart0TxSrc(SimUart0TxSrc simUart0TxSrc) {
1193  sim().SOPT5 = (sim().SOPT5&~SIM_SOPT5_UART0TXSRC_MASK)|simUart0TxSrc;
1194  }
1195 
1196  //! System Options Register 5
1197  static constexpr uint32_t sopt5 =
1198  SIM_SOPT5_UART0TXSRC(0) | // UART 0 transmit data source select
1199  SIM_SOPT5_UART0RXSRC(0) | // UART 0 receive data source select
1200  SIM_SOPT5_UART1TXSRC(0) | // UART 1 transmit data source select
1201  SIM_SOPT5_UART1RXSRC(0) | // UART 1 receive data source select
1202  #ifdef SIM_SOPT5_LPUART0RXSRC
1203  SIM_SOPT5_LPUART0RXSRC(-1) | // LPUART 0 receive data source select
1204  #endif
1205  #ifdef SIM_SOPT5_LPUART0TXSRC
1206  SIM_SOPT5_LPUART0TXSRC(-1) | // LPUART 0 transmit data source select
1207  #endif
1208  0;
1209 
1210  /**
1211  * Select the ADC0 Trigger source
1212  *
1213  * If PDB is selected by SimAdc0Trigger then Pre-trigger 0/1 is determined by the PDB setup,
1214  * otherwise Pre-trigger 0/1 is determined by this parameter.
1215  * For example, setAdc0Triggers(SimAdc0TriggerMode_Alt_PreTrigger_1, SimAdc0Trigger_PitCh0) will set the trigger source
1216  * to PIT channel 0 and conversion will use SC1[1]/R[1].
1217  *
1218  * @param[in] simAdc0TriggerMode Select ADC0 Trigger mode
1219  * @param[in] simAdc0Trigger Select the ADC0 Trigger source in STOP and VLPS modes, or when ADC0 Alternative Trigger is active.
1220  */
1221  static void setAdc0Triggers(SimAdc0TriggerMode simAdc0TriggerMode, SimAdc0Trigger simAdc0Trigger=SimAdc0Trigger_PdbExTrig) {
1222  sim().SOPT7 = (sim().SOPT7&~(SIM_SOPT7_ADC0TRGSEL_MASK|SIM_SOPT7_ADC0ALTTRGEN_MASK))|simAdc0Trigger|simAdc0TriggerMode;
1223  };
1224 
1225  //! System Options Register 7
1226  static constexpr uint32_t sopt7 =
1227  #ifdef SIM_SOPT7_ADC1ALTTRGEN
1228  SIM_SOPT7_ADC1ALTTRGEN(-1) | // ADC1 alternate trigger enable
1229  SIM_SOPT7_ADC1PRETRGSEL(-1) | // ADC1 pretrigger select
1230  SIM_SOPT7_ADC1TRGSEL(-1) | // ADC1 trigger select
1231 
1232  #endif
1233  SIM_SOPT7_ADC0ALTTRGEN(0) | // ADC0 alternate trigger enable
1234  SIM_SOPT7_ADC0PRETRGSEL(0) | // ADC0 pretrigger select
1235  SIM_SOPT7_ADC0TRGSEL(0); // ADC0 trigger select
1236 
1237  #ifdef SIM_CLKDIV2_USBDIV_MASK
1238  //! System Clock Divider Register 2
1239  //! USB clock divider divisor & fraction
1240  static constexpr uint32_t clkdiv2 = 2;
1241  #endif
1242 
1243  /**
1244  * Initialise SIM registers
1245  */
1246  static void initRegs() {
1247  #ifdef SIM_SCGC4_USBOTG_MASK
1248  // The USB interface must be disabled for clock changes to have effect
1249  sim().SCGC4 &= ~SIM_SCGC4_USBOTG_MASK;
1250  #endif
1251 
1252  sim().SOPT1 = sopt1;
1253  // sim_sopt2_pllfllsel may also be altered by MCG clock code
1254  sim().SOPT2 = sopt2;
1255  sim().SOPT4 = sopt4;
1256  sim().SOPT5 = sopt5;
1257  sim().SOPT7 = sopt7;
1258 
1259  #ifdef SIM_CLKDIV2_USBDIV_MASK
1260  sim().CLKDIV2 = clkdiv2;
1261  #endif
1262  }
1263 
1264 };
1265 
1266 /**
1267  * End group SIM_Group
1268  * @}
1269  */
1270 /**
1271  * @addtogroup ADC_Group ADC, Analogue Input
1272  * @brief Abstraction for Analogue Input
1273  * @{
1274  */
1275 #define USBDM_ADC0_IS_DEFINED
1276 /**
1277  * Peripheral information for ADC, Analogue Input.
1278  *
1279  * This may include pin information, constants, register addresses, and default register values,
1280  * along with simple accessor functions.
1281  */
1282 #ifndef USBDM_ADC_CLOCK_SOURCES_DEFINED
1283 #define USBDM_ADC_CLOCK_SOURCES_DEFINED
1284  /**
1285  * ADC input clock source.
1286  */
1287  enum AdcClockSource {
1288  AdcClockSource_Bus = ADC_CFG1_ADICLK(0), //!< Bus Clock
1289  AdcClockSource_Busdiv2 = ADC_CFG1_ADICLK(1), //!< Bus Clock / 2
1290  AdcClockSource_Alt = ADC_CFG1_ADICLK(2), //!< Alternate clock (ALTCLK)
1291  AdcClockSource_Asynch = ADC_CFG1_ADICLK(3), //!< Asynchronous clock (ADACK Internal ADC clock source)
1292  AdcClockSource_Default = AdcClockSource_Asynch
1293  };
1294 #endif
1295 
1296 class Adc0Info {
1297 public:
1298  // Template:adc0_diff_a
1299 
1300  //! Hardware base address as uint32_t
1301  static constexpr uint32_t baseAddress = ADC0_BasePtr;
1302 
1303  //! Hardware base pointer
1304  __attribute__((always_inline)) static volatile ADC_Type &adc() {
1305  return *(ADC_Type *)baseAddress;
1306  }
1307 
1308  //! Base value for PCR (excluding MUX value)
1309  static constexpr uint32_t defaultPcrValue = 0;
1310 
1311  //! Map all allocated pins on a peripheral when enabled
1312  static constexpr bool mapPinsOnEnable = false;
1313 
1314  //! IRQ numbers for hardware
1315  static constexpr IRQn_Type irqNums[] = ADC0_IRQS;
1316 
1317  //! Number of IRQs for hardware
1318  static constexpr uint32_t irqCount = sizeof(irqNums)/sizeof(irqNums[0]);
1319 
1320  //! Class based callback handler has been installed in vector table
1321  static constexpr bool irqHandlerInstalled = 0;
1322 
1323  //! Default IRQ level
1324  static constexpr uint32_t irqLevel = 8;
1325 
1326  /**
1327  * Get input clock frequency for ADC
1328  *
1329  * @param adcClockSource Clock source chosen for ADC
1330  *
1331  * @return Frequency in Hz
1332  */
1333  static unsigned getInputClockFrequency(AdcClockSource adcClockSource) {
1334  switch (adcClockSource) {
1335  case AdcClockSource_Bus:
1336  return SystemBusClock;
1337  case AdcClockSource_Busdiv2:
1338  return SystemBusClock/2;
1339  case AdcClockSource_Alt:
1340  return Osc0Info::getOscerClock();;
1341  case AdcClockSource_Asynch:
1342  return 2000000; // Actually varies with ADLPC/ADHSC
1343  default:
1344  return 0;
1345  break;
1346  }
1347  }
1348 
1349  /**
1350  * Get input clock frequency for ADC
1351  *
1352  * @return Frequency in Hz
1353  */
1354  static unsigned getInputClockFrequency() {
1355  return getInputClockFrequency((AdcClockSource)(adc().CFG1 & ADC_CFG1_ADICLK_MASK));
1356  }
1357 
1358  //! Default value for ADCx_CFG1 register
1359  static constexpr uint32_t cfg1 =
1360  ADC_CFG1_ADICLK(3)|
1361  ADC_CFG1_MODE(2)|
1362  ADC_CFG1_ADLSMP(0)|
1363  ADC_CFG1_ADIV(0)|
1364  ADC_CFG1_ADLPC(0);
1365 
1366  //! Default value for ADCx_CFG2 register
1367  static constexpr uint32_t cfg2 =
1368  ADC_CFG2_MUXSEL_MASK | // Choose 'b' channels
1369  ADC_CFG2_ADLSTS(0)|
1370  ADC_CFG2_ADHSC(0)|
1371  ADC_CFG2_ADACKEN(0);
1372 
1373  //! Default value for ADCx_SC2 register
1374  static constexpr uint32_t sc2 =
1375  ADC_SC2_ACFE(0)|
1376  ADC_SC2_ACFGT(0)|
1377  ADC_SC2_ACREN(0)|
1378  ADC_SC2_REFSEL(0)|
1379  ADC_SC2_DMAEN(0)|
1380  ADC_SC2_ADTRG(0);
1381 
1382  //! Default value for ADCx_CV1 register
1383  static constexpr uint32_t cv1 = 0;
1384 
1385  //! Default value for ADCx_CV2 register
1386  static constexpr uint32_t cv2 = 0;
1387 
1388  /**
1389  * Enable clock to Adc0
1390  */
1391  static void enableClock() {
1392 #ifdef PCC
1393  PccInfo::enableAdc0Clock();
1394 #else
1395  SIM->SCGC6 |= SIM_SCGC6_ADC0_MASK;
1396 #endif
1397  }
1398 
1399  /**
1400  * Disable clock to Adc0
1401  */
1402  static void disableClock() {
1403 #ifdef PCC
1404  PccInfo::disableAdc0Clock();
1405 #else
1406  SIM->SCGC6 &= ~SIM_SCGC6_ADC0_MASK;
1407 #endif
1408  }
1409 
1410  //! Number of signals available in info table
1411  static constexpr int numSignals = 24;
1412 
1413  //! Information for each signal of peripheral
1414  static constexpr PinInfo info[] = {
1415 
1416  // Signal Pin portInfo gpioAddress gpioBit PCR value
1417  /* 0: ADC0_SE0 = ADC0_DP0 (A10) */ { NoPortInfo, 0, FIXED_NO_PCR, 0 },
1418  /* 1: -- = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, INVALID_PCR, 0 },
1419  /* 2: -- = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, INVALID_PCR, 0 },
1420  /* 3: ADC0_SE3 = ADC0_DP3 (A8) */ { NoPortInfo, 0, FIXED_NO_PCR, 0 },
1421  /* 4: ADC0_SE4b = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
1422  /* 5: ADC0_SE5b = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
1423  /* 6: ADC0_SE6b = PTD5 (A3) */ { PortDInfo, GPIOD_BasePtr, 5, PORT_PCR_MUX(0)|defaultPcrValue },
1424  /* 7: ADC0_SE7b = PTD6 (A2) */ { PortDInfo, GPIOD_BasePtr, 6, PORT_PCR_MUX(0)|defaultPcrValue },
1425  /* 8: ADC0_SE8 = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
1426  /* 9: ADC0_SE9 = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
1427  /* 10: -- = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, INVALID_PCR, 0 },
1428  /* 11: -- = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, INVALID_PCR, 0 },
1429  /* 12: ADC0_SE12 = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
1430  /* 13: ADC0_SE13 = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
1431  /* 14: ADC0_SE14 = PTC0 (A0) */ { PortCInfo, GPIOC_BasePtr, 0, PORT_PCR_MUX(0)|defaultPcrValue },
1432  /* 15: ADC0_SE15 = PTC1 (A1) */ { PortCInfo, GPIOC_BasePtr, 1, PORT_PCR_MUX(0)|defaultPcrValue },
1433  /* 16: -- = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, INVALID_PCR, 0 },
1434  /* 17: -- = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, INVALID_PCR, 0 },
1435  /* 18: -- = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, INVALID_PCR, 0 },
1436  /* 19: ADC0_SE19 = ADC0_DM0 (A11) */ { NoPortInfo, 0, FIXED_NO_PCR, 0 },
1437  /* 20: -- = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, INVALID_PCR, 0 },
1438  /* 21: ADC0_SE21 = ADC0_DM3 (A9) */ { NoPortInfo, 0, FIXED_NO_PCR, 0 },
1439  /* 22: -- = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, INVALID_PCR, 0 },
1440  /* 23: ADC0_SE23 = ADC0_SE23 (A7) */ { NoPortInfo, 0, FIXED_NO_PCR, 0 },
1441  };
1442 
1443  /**
1444  * Initialise pins used by peripheral
1445  *
1446  * @param pcrValue PCR value controlling pin options
1447  */
1448  static void initPCRs(uint32_t pcrValue=defaultPcrValue) {
1449 #ifdef PCC_PCCn_CGC_MASK
1450  PCC->PCC_PORTC = PCC_PCCn_CGC_MASK;
1451  PCC->PCC_PORTD = PCC_PCCn_CGC_MASK;
1452 #else
1453  enablePortClocks(PORTC_CLOCK_MASK|PORTD_CLOCK_MASK);
1454 #endif
1455  PORTC->GPCLR = pcrValue|PORT_PCR_MUX(0)|PORT_GPCLR_GPWE(0x0003UL);
1456  PORTD->GPCLR = pcrValue|PORT_PCR_MUX(0)|PORT_GPCLR_GPWE(0x0060UL);
1457  }
1458 
1459  /**
1460  * Resets pins used by peripheral
1461  */
1462  static void clearPCRs() {
1463 #ifdef PCC_PCCn_CGC_MASK
1464  PCC->PCC_PORTC = PCC_PCCn_CGC_MASK;
1465  PCC->PCC_PORTD = PCC_PCCn_CGC_MASK;
1466 #else
1467  enablePortClocks(PORTC_CLOCK_MASK|PORTD_CLOCK_MASK);
1468 #endif
1469  PORTC->GPCLR = PORT_PCR_MUX(0)|PORT_GPCLR_GPWE(0x3U);
1470  PORTD->GPCLR = PORT_PCR_MUX(0)|PORT_GPCLR_GPWE(0x60U);
1471  }
1472 
1473 #define USBDM_ADC0_INFODP_IS_DEFINED
1474  class InfoDP {
1475  public:
1476  //! Number of signals available in info table
1477  static constexpr int numSignals = 4;
1478 
1479  //! Information for each signal of peripheral
1480  static constexpr PinInfo info[] = {
1481 
1482  // Signal Pin portInfo gpioAddress gpioBit PCR value
1483  /* 0: ADC0_DP0 = ADC0_DP0 (A10) */ { NoPortInfo, 0, FIXED_NO_PCR, 0 },
1484  /* 1: -- = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, INVALID_PCR, 0 },
1485  /* 2: -- = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, INVALID_PCR, 0 },
1486  /* 3: ADC0_DP3 = ADC0_DP3 (A8) */ { NoPortInfo, 0, FIXED_NO_PCR, 0 },
1487  };
1488 
1489  /**
1490  * Initialise pins used by peripheral
1491  *
1492  * @param pcrValue PCR value controlling pin options
1493  */
1494  static void initPCRs(uint32_t pcrValue=defaultPcrValue) {
1495  (void)pcrValue;
1496  }
1497 
1498  /**
1499  * Resets pins used by peripheral
1500  */
1501  static void clearPCRs() {
1502  }
1503 
1504  };
1505 
1506 #define USBDM_ADC0_INFODM_IS_DEFINED
1507  class InfoDM {
1508  public:
1509  //! Number of signals available in info table
1510  static constexpr int numSignals = 4;
1511 
1512  //! Information for each signal of peripheral
1513  static constexpr PinInfo info[] = {
1514 
1515  // Signal Pin portInfo gpioAddress gpioBit PCR value
1516  /* 0: ADC0_DM0 = ADC0_DM0 (A11) */ { NoPortInfo, 0, FIXED_NO_PCR, 0 },
1517  /* 1: -- = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, INVALID_PCR, 0 },
1518  /* 2: -- = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, INVALID_PCR, 0 },
1519  /* 3: ADC0_DM3 = ADC0_DM3 (A9) */ { NoPortInfo, 0, FIXED_NO_PCR, 0 },
1520  };
1521 
1522  /**
1523  * Initialise pins used by peripheral
1524  *
1525  * @param pcrValue PCR value controlling pin options
1526  */
1527  static void initPCRs(uint32_t pcrValue=defaultPcrValue) {
1528  (void)pcrValue;
1529  }
1530 
1531  /**
1532  * Resets pins used by peripheral
1533  */
1534  static void clearPCRs() {
1535  }
1536 
1537  };
1538 
1539 };
1540 
1541 /**
1542  * End group ADC_Group
1543  * @}
1544  */
1545 /**
1546  * @addtogroup CMP_Group CMP, Analogue Comparator
1547  * @brief Abstraction for Analogue Comparator
1548  * @{
1549  */
1550 #define USBDM_CMP0_IS_DEFINED
1551 /**
1552  * Peripheral information for CMP, Analogue Comparator.
1553  *
1554  * This may include pin information, constants, register addresses, and default register values,
1555  * along with simple accessor functions.
1556  */
1557 class Cmp0Info {
1558 public:
1559  // Template:cmp0
1560 
1561  //! Hardware base address as uint32_t
1562  static constexpr uint32_t baseAddress = CMP0_BasePtr;
1563 
1564  //! Hardware base pointer
1565  __attribute__((always_inline)) static volatile CMP_Type &cmp() {
1566  return *(CMP_Type *)baseAddress;
1567  }
1568 
1569  //! Base value for PCR (excluding MUX value)
1570  static constexpr uint32_t defaultPcrValue = 0;
1571 
1572  //! Pin number in Info table for comparator output
1573  static constexpr int outputPin = 8;
1574 
1575  //! Map all allocated pins on a peripheral when enabled
1576  static constexpr bool mapPinsOnEnable = false;
1577 
1578  //! CMP Control Register 0
1579  static constexpr uint32_t cr0 =
1580  CMP_CR0_FILTER_CNT(0) | // Filter Sample Count
1581  CMP_CR0_HYSTCTR(0); // Comparator hard block hysteresis control
1582 
1583  #ifndef CMP_CR1_TRIGM
1584  #define CMP_CR1_TRIGM(x) 0
1585  #endif
1586 
1587  //! CMP Control Register 1
1588  static constexpr uint32_t cr1 =
1589  CMP_CR1_SE(0) | // Sample Enable
1590  CMP_CR1_WE(0) | // Windowing Enable
1591  CMP_CR1_TRIGM(0) | // Trigger Mode Enable
1592  CMP_CR1_PMODE(0) | // Power mode Select
1593  CMP_CR1_INV(0) | // Comparator Invert
1594  CMP_CR1_COS(0) | // Comparator Output Select
1595  CMP_CR1_OPE(0); // Comparator Output Pin Enable
1596 
1597  //! CMP Filter Period Register
1598  static constexpr uint32_t fpr =
1599  CMP_FPR_FILT_PER(0); // Filter Sample Period
1600 
1601  //! CMP Status and Control Register
1602  static constexpr uint32_t scr =
1603  #ifdef CMP_SCR_DMAEN
1604  CMP_SCR_DMAEN(0) | // DMA Enable Control
1605  #endif
1606  CMP_SCR_IER(0) | // Comparator Interrupt Enable Rising
1607  CMP_SCR_IEF(0); // Comparator Interrupt Enable Falling
1608 
1609  //! DAC Control Register
1610  static constexpr uint32_t daccr =
1611  CMP_DACCR_VRSEL(0); // Supply Voltage Reference Source Select
1612 
1613  //! MUX Control Register
1614  static constexpr uint32_t muxcr =
1615  CMP_MUXCR_PSEL(0)| // Plus Input Mux Control
1616  CMP_MUXCR_MSEL(0); // Minus Input Mux Control
1617 
1618  /**
1619  * Enable clock to Cmp0
1620  */
1621  static void enableClock() {
1622 #ifdef PCC
1623  PccInfo::enableCmp0Clock();
1624 #else
1625  SIM->SCGC4 |= SIM_SCGC4_CMP_MASK;
1626 #endif
1627  }
1628 
1629  /**
1630  * Disable clock to Cmp0
1631  */
1632  static void disableClock() {
1633 #ifdef PCC
1634  PccInfo::disableCmp0Clock();
1635 #else
1636  SIM->SCGC4 &= ~SIM_SCGC4_CMP_MASK;
1637 #endif
1638  }
1639 
1640  //! IRQ numbers for hardware
1641  static constexpr IRQn_Type irqNums[] = CMP0_IRQS;
1642 
1643  //! Number of IRQs for hardware
1644  static constexpr uint32_t irqCount = sizeof(irqNums)/sizeof(irqNums[0]);
1645 
1646  //! Class based callback handler has been installed in vector table
1647  static constexpr bool irqHandlerInstalled = 0;
1648 
1649  //! Default IRQ level
1650  static constexpr uint32_t irqLevel = 8;
1651 
1652  //! Number of signals available in info table
1653  static constexpr int numSignals = 9;
1654 
1655  //! Information for each signal of peripheral
1656  static constexpr PinInfo info[] = {
1657 
1658  // Signal Pin portInfo gpioAddress gpioBit PCR value
1659  /* 0: CMP0_IN0 = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
1660  /* 1: CMP0_IN1 = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
1661  /* 2: CMP0_IN2 = PTC8 (D4) */ { PortCInfo, GPIOC_BasePtr, 8, PORT_PCR_MUX(0)|defaultPcrValue },
1662  /* 3: CMP0_IN3 = PTC9 (D23) */ { PortCInfo, GPIOC_BasePtr, 9, PORT_PCR_MUX(0)|defaultPcrValue },
1663  /* 4: -- = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, INVALID_PCR, 0 },
1664  /* 5: CMP0_IN5 = VREF_OUT (A6) */ { NoPortInfo, 0, FIXED_NO_PCR, 0 },
1665  /* 6: -- = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, INVALID_PCR, 0 },
1666  /* 7: -- = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, INVALID_PCR, 0 },
1667  /* 8: CMP0_OUT = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
1668  };
1669 
1670  /**
1671  * Initialise pins used by peripheral
1672  *
1673  * @param pcrValue PCR value controlling pin options
1674  */
1675  static void initPCRs(uint32_t pcrValue=defaultPcrValue) {
1676 #ifdef PCC_PCCn_CGC_MASK
1677  PCC->PCC_PORTC = PCC_PCCn_CGC_MASK;
1678 #else
1679  enablePortClocks(PORTC_CLOCK_MASK);
1680 #endif
1681  PORTC->GPCLR = pcrValue|PORT_PCR_MUX(0)|PORT_GPCLR_GPWE(0x0300UL);
1682  }
1683 
1684  /**
1685  * Resets pins used by peripheral
1686  */
1687  static void clearPCRs() {
1688 #ifdef PCC_PCCn_CGC_MASK
1689  PCC->PCC_PORTC = PCC_PCCn_CGC_MASK;
1690 #else
1691  enablePortClocks(PORTC_CLOCK_MASK);
1692 #endif
1693  PORTC->GPCLR = PORT_PCR_MUX(0)|PORT_GPCLR_GPWE(0x300U);
1694  }
1695 
1696 };
1697 
1698 #define USBDM_CMP1_IS_DEFINED
1699 /**
1700  * Peripheral information for CMP, Analogue Comparator.
1701  *
1702  * This may include pin information, constants, register addresses, and default register values,
1703  * along with simple accessor functions.
1704  */
1705 class Cmp1Info {
1706 public:
1707  // Template:cmp0
1708 
1709  //! Hardware base address as uint32_t
1710  static constexpr uint32_t baseAddress = CMP1_BasePtr;
1711 
1712  //! Hardware base pointer
1713  __attribute__((always_inline)) static volatile CMP_Type &cmp() {
1714  return *(CMP_Type *)baseAddress;
1715  }
1716 
1717  //! Base value for PCR (excluding MUX value)
1718  static constexpr uint32_t defaultPcrValue = 0;
1719 
1720  //! Pin number in Info table for comparator output
1721  static constexpr int outputPin = 8;
1722 
1723  //! Map all allocated pins on a peripheral when enabled
1724  static constexpr bool mapPinsOnEnable = false;
1725 
1726  //! CMP Control Register 0
1727  static constexpr uint32_t cr0 =
1728  CMP_CR0_FILTER_CNT(0) | // Filter Sample Count
1729  CMP_CR0_HYSTCTR(0); // Comparator hard block hysteresis control
1730 
1731  #ifndef CMP_CR1_TRIGM
1732  #define CMP_CR1_TRIGM(x) 0
1733  #endif
1734 
1735  //! CMP Control Register 1
1736  static constexpr uint32_t cr1 =
1737  CMP_CR1_SE(0) | // Sample Enable
1738  CMP_CR1_WE(0) | // Windowing Enable
1739  CMP_CR1_TRIGM(0) | // Trigger Mode Enable
1740  CMP_CR1_PMODE(0) | // Power mode Select
1741  CMP_CR1_INV(0) | // Comparator Invert
1742  CMP_CR1_COS(0) | // Comparator Output Select
1743  CMP_CR1_OPE(0); // Comparator Output Pin Enable
1744 
1745  //! CMP Filter Period Register
1746  static constexpr uint32_t fpr =
1747  CMP_FPR_FILT_PER(0); // Filter Sample Period
1748 
1749  //! CMP Status and Control Register
1750  static constexpr uint32_t scr =
1751  #ifdef CMP_SCR_DMAEN
1752  CMP_SCR_DMAEN(0) | // DMA Enable Control
1753  #endif
1754  CMP_SCR_IER(0) | // Comparator Interrupt Enable Rising
1755  CMP_SCR_IEF(0); // Comparator Interrupt Enable Falling
1756 
1757  //! DAC Control Register
1758  static constexpr uint32_t daccr =
1759  CMP_DACCR_VRSEL(0); // Supply Voltage Reference Source Select
1760 
1761  //! MUX Control Register
1762  static constexpr uint32_t muxcr =
1763  CMP_MUXCR_PSEL(0)| // Plus Input Mux Control
1764  CMP_MUXCR_MSEL(0); // Minus Input Mux Control
1765 
1766  /**
1767  * Enable clock to Cmp1
1768  */
1769  static void enableClock() {
1770 #ifdef PCC
1771  PccInfo::enableCmp1Clock();
1772 #else
1773  SIM->SCGC4 |= SIM_SCGC4_CMP_MASK;
1774 #endif
1775  }
1776 
1777  /**
1778  * Disable clock to Cmp1
1779  */
1780  static void disableClock() {
1781 #ifdef PCC
1782  PccInfo::disableCmp1Clock();
1783 #else
1784  SIM->SCGC4 &= ~SIM_SCGC4_CMP_MASK;
1785 #endif
1786  }
1787 
1788  //! IRQ numbers for hardware
1789  static constexpr IRQn_Type irqNums[] = CMP1_IRQS;
1790 
1791  //! Number of IRQs for hardware
1792  static constexpr uint32_t irqCount = sizeof(irqNums)/sizeof(irqNums[0]);
1793 
1794  //! Class based callback handler has been installed in vector table
1795  static constexpr bool irqHandlerInstalled = 0;
1796 
1797  //! Default IRQ level
1798  static constexpr uint32_t irqLevel = 8;
1799 
1800  //! Number of signals available in info table
1801  static constexpr int numSignals = 9;
1802 
1803  //! Information for each signal of peripheral
1804  static constexpr PinInfo info[] = {
1805 
1806  // Signal Pin portInfo gpioAddress gpioBit PCR value
1807  /* 0: CMP1_IN0 = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
1808  /* 1: CMP1_IN1 = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
1809  /* 2: -- = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, INVALID_PCR, 0 },
1810  /* 3: CMP1_IN3 = ADC0_SE23 (A7) */ { NoPortInfo, 0, FIXED_NO_PCR, 0 },
1811  /* 4: -- = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, INVALID_PCR, 0 },
1812  /* 5: CMP1_IN5 = VREF_OUT (A6) */ { NoPortInfo, 0, FIXED_NO_PCR, 0 },
1813  /* 6: -- = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, INVALID_PCR, 0 },
1814  /* 7: -- = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, INVALID_PCR, 0 },
1815  /* 8: CMP1_OUT = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
1816  };
1817 
1818  /**
1819  * Initialise pins used by peripheral
1820  *
1821  * @param pcrValue PCR value controlling pin options
1822  */
1823  static void initPCRs(uint32_t pcrValue=defaultPcrValue) {
1824  (void)pcrValue;
1825  }
1826 
1827  /**
1828  * Resets pins used by peripheral
1829  */
1830  static void clearPCRs() {
1831  }
1832 
1833 };
1834 
1835 /**
1836  * End group CMP_Group
1837  * @}
1838  */
1839 /**
1840  * @addtogroup CMT_Group CMT, Carrier Modulator Transmitter
1841  * @brief Abstraction for Carrier Modulator Transmitter
1842  * @{
1843  */
1844 #define USBDM_CMT_IS_DEFINED
1845 /**
1846  * Peripheral information for CMT, Carrier Modulator Transmitter.
1847  *
1848  * This may include pin information, constants, register addresses, and default register values,
1849  * along with simple accessor functions.
1850  */
1851 class CmtInfo {
1852 public:
1853  // Template:cmt_0
1854 
1855  //! Hardware base address as uint32_t
1856  static constexpr uint32_t baseAddress = CMT_BasePtr;
1857 
1858  //! Hardware base pointer
1859  __attribute__((always_inline)) static volatile CMT_Type &cmt() {
1860  return *(CMT_Type *)baseAddress;
1861  }
1862 
1863  //! Base value for PCR (excluding MUX value)
1864  static constexpr uint32_t defaultPcrValue =
1865  PORT_PCR_LK(0) | // Lock Register
1866  PORT_PCR_DSE(0) | // Drive Strength Enable
1867  PORT_PCR_ODE(0) | // Open Drain Enable
1868  PORT_PCR_PFE(0) | // Passive Filter Enable
1869  PORT_PCR_SRE(0) | // Slew Rate Enable
1870  PORT_PCR_PS(0); // Pull device
1871 
1872  //! Map all allocated pins on a peripheral when enabled
1873  static constexpr bool mapPinsOnEnable = false;
1874 
1875  //! IRQ numbers for hardware
1876  static constexpr IRQn_Type irqNums[] = CMT_IRQS;
1877 
1878  //! Number of IRQs for hardware
1879  static constexpr uint32_t irqCount = sizeof(irqNums)/sizeof(irqNums[0]);
1880 
1881  //! Class based callback handler has been installed in vector table
1882  static constexpr bool irqHandlerInstalled = 0;
1883 
1884  //! Default IRQ level
1885  static constexpr uint32_t irqLevel = 8;
1886 
1887  /**
1888  * Enable clock to Cmt
1889  */
1890  static void enableClock() {
1891 #ifdef PCC
1892  PccInfo::enableCmtClock();
1893 #else
1894  SIM->SCGC4 |= SIM_SCGC4_CMT_MASK;
1895 #endif
1896  }
1897 
1898  /**
1899  * Disable clock to Cmt
1900  */
1901  static void disableClock() {
1902 #ifdef PCC
1903  PccInfo::disableCmtClock();
1904 #else
1905  SIM->SCGC4 &= ~SIM_SCGC4_CMT_MASK;
1906 #endif
1907  }
1908 
1909  //! Number of signals available in info table
1910  static constexpr int numSignals = 1;
1911 
1912  //! Information for each signal of peripheral
1913  static constexpr PinInfo info[] = {
1914 
1915  // Signal Pin portInfo gpioAddress gpioBit PCR value
1916  /* 0: CMT_IRO = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
1917  };
1918 
1919  /**
1920  * Initialise pins used by peripheral
1921  *
1922  * @param pcrValue PCR value controlling pin options
1923  */
1924  static void initPCRs(uint32_t pcrValue=defaultPcrValue) {
1925  (void)pcrValue;
1926  }
1927 
1928  /**
1929  * Resets pins used by peripheral
1930  */
1931  static void clearPCRs() {
1932  }
1933 
1934 };
1935 
1936 /**
1937  * End group CMT_Group
1938  * @}
1939  */
1940 /**
1941  * @addtogroup Control_Group CONTROL, Control
1942  * @brief Abstraction for Control
1943  * @{
1944  */
1945 #define USBDM_CONTROL_IS_DEFINED
1946 /**
1947  * Peripheral information for CONTROL, Control.
1948  *
1949  * This may include pin information, constants, register addresses, and default register values,
1950  * along with simple accessor functions.
1951  */
1952 class ControlInfo {
1953 public:
1954  // Template:control
1955 
1956  //! Base value for PCR (excluding MUX value)
1957  static constexpr uint32_t defaultPcrValue = 0;
1958 
1959  //! Number of signals available in info table
1960  static constexpr int numSignals = 10;
1961 
1962  //! Information for each signal of peripheral
1963  static constexpr PinInfo info[] = {
1964 
1965  // Signal Pin portInfo gpioAddress gpioBit PCR value
1966  /* 0: RESET_b = RESET_b (RESET_b) */ { NoPortInfo, 0, FIXED_NO_PCR, 0 },
1967  /* 1: JTAG_TCLK = PTA0 (SWD_CLK) */ { PortAInfo, GPIOA_BasePtr, 0, PORT_PCR_MUX(7)|defaultPcrValue },
1968  /* 2: SWD_CLK = PTA0 (SWD_CLK) */ { PortAInfo, GPIOA_BasePtr, 0, PORT_PCR_MUX(7)|defaultPcrValue },
1969  /* 3: JTAG_TDI = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
1970  /* 4: JTAG_TDO = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
1971  /* 5: TRACE_SWO = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
1972  /* 6: JTAG_TMS = PTA3 (SWD_DIO) */ { PortAInfo, GPIOA_BasePtr, 3, PORT_PCR_MUX(7)|defaultPcrValue },
1973  /* 7: SWD_DIO = PTA3 (SWD_DIO) */ { PortAInfo, GPIOA_BasePtr, 3, PORT_PCR_MUX(7)|defaultPcrValue },
1974  /* 8: NMI_b = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
1975  /* 9: JTAG_TRST_b = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
1976  };
1977 
1978  /**
1979  * Initialise pins used by peripheral
1980  *
1981  * @param pcrValue PCR value controlling pin options
1982  */
1983  static void initPCRs(uint32_t pcrValue=defaultPcrValue) {
1984 #ifdef PCC_PCCn_CGC_MASK
1985  PCC->PCC_PORTA = PCC_PCCn_CGC_MASK;
1986 #else
1987  enablePortClocks(PORTA_CLOCK_MASK);
1988 #endif
1989  PORTA->GPCLR = pcrValue|PORT_PCR_MUX(7)|PORT_GPCLR_GPWE(0x0009UL);
1990  }
1991 
1992  /**
1993  * Resets pins used by peripheral
1994  */
1995  static void clearPCRs() {
1996 #ifdef PCC_PCCn_CGC_MASK
1997  PCC->PCC_PORTA = PCC_PCCn_CGC_MASK;
1998 #else
1999  enablePortClocks(PORTA_CLOCK_MASK);
2000 #endif
2001  PORTA->GPCLR = PORT_PCR_MUX(0)|PORT_GPCLR_GPWE(0x9U);
2002  }
2003 
2004 };
2005 
2006 /**
2007  * End group Control_Group
2008  * @}
2009  */
2010 /**
2011  * @addtogroup CRC_Group CRC, Cyclic Redundancy Check
2012  * @brief Abstraction for Cyclic Redundancy Check
2013  * @{
2014  */
2015 #define USBDM_CRC0_IS_DEFINED
2016 /**
2017  * Peripheral information for CRC, Cyclic Redundancy Check.
2018  *
2019  * This may include pin information, constants, register addresses, and default register values,
2020  * along with simple accessor functions.
2021  */

2023 public:

2031  return *(CRC_Type *)baseAddress;
2032  }

2037  * Enable clock to Crc0
2038  */
2039  static void enableClock() {
2040 #ifdef PCC
2041  PccInfo::enableCrc0Clock();
2042 #else
2043  SIM->SCGC6 |= SIM_SCGC6_CRC_MASK;
2044 #endif
2045  }

2055 #endif

2073 /**
2074  * @addtogroup DMA_Group DMA, Direct Memory Access (DMA)
2075  * @brief Abstraction for Direct Memory Access (DMA)
2076  * @{
2077  */
2078 #define USBDM_DMA0_IS_DEFINED
2079 /**
2080  * Peripheral information for DMA, Direct Memory Access (DMA).
2081  *
2082  * This may include pin information, constants, register addresses, and default register values,
2083  * along with simple accessor functions.
2084  */
2085 class Dma0Info {
2086 public:
2087  // Template:dma0_4ch
2088 
2089  //! Hardware base address as uint32_t
2090  static constexpr uint32_t baseAddress = DMA0_BasePtr;
2091 
2092  //! Hardware base pointer
2093  __attribute__((always_inline)) static volatile DMA_Type &dma() {
2094  return *(DMA_Type *)baseAddress;
2095  }
2096 
2097  /**
2098  * Enable clock to Dma0
2099  */
2100  static void enableClock() {
2101 #ifdef PCC
2102  // DMA is always clocked
2103 #else
2104  SIM->SCGC7 |= SIM_SCGC7_DMA_MASK;
2105 #endif
2106  }
2107 
2108  /**
2109  * Disable clock to Dma0
2110  */
2111  static void disableClock() {
2112 #ifdef PCC
2113  // DMA is always clocked
2114 #else
2115  SIM->SCGC7 &= ~SIM_SCGC7_DMA_MASK;
2116 #endif
2117  }
2118 
2119  //! IRQ numbers for hardware
2120  static constexpr IRQn_Type irqNums[] = DMA0_IRQS;
2121 
2122  //! Number of IRQs for hardware
2123  static constexpr uint32_t irqCount = sizeof(irqNums)/sizeof(irqNums[0]);
2124 
2125  //! Class based callback handler has been installed in vector table
2126  static constexpr bool irqHandlerInstalled = 0;
2127 
2128  //! Default IRQ level
2129  static constexpr uint32_t irqLevel = 8;
2130 
2131  //! Number of DMA channels implemented
2132  static constexpr unsigned NumChannels = 4;
2133 
2134  //! Number of DMA vectors implemented
2135  static constexpr unsigned NumVectors = 4;
2136 
2137 };
2138

2140  * End group DMA_Group
2141  * @}
2142  */
2143 /**

2146  * @{
2147  */

2164  return *(DMAMUX_Type *)baseAddress;
2165  }
2166

2168  * Enable clock to Dmamux0
2169  */

2171 #ifdef PCC
2172  PccInfo::enableDmamux0Clock();
2173 #else

2175 #endif
2176  }

2180  */

2184 #else

2186 #endif
2187  }

2191

2193  static constexpr uint8_t chcfg1_source = DMAMUX_CHCFG_SOURCE(0);
2194  static constexpr uint8_t chcfg2_source = DMAMUX_CHCFG_SOURCE(0);
2195  static constexpr uint8_t chcfg3_source = DMAMUX_CHCFG_SOURCE(0);
2196 };

2228  PORT_PCR_LK(0) | // Lock Register
2229  PORT_PCR_DSE(0) | // Drive Strength Enable
2230  PORT_PCR_ODE(0) | // Open Drain Enable
2231  PORT_PCR_PFE(0) | // Passive Filter Enable

2304 /**
