2307  * @{
2308  */
2309 #define USBDM_FTFL_IS_DEFINED
2310 /**
2311  * Peripheral information for FTFL, Flash Memory Module.
2312  *
2313  * This may include pin information, constants, register addresses, and default register values,
2314  * along with simple accessor functions.
2315  */
2316 class FtflInfo {
2317 public:
2318  // Template:ftfl_32k_flexrom
2319 
2320  //! Hardware base address as uint32_t
2321  static constexpr uint32_t baseAddress = FTFL_BasePtr;
2322 
2323  //! Hardware base pointer
2324  __attribute__((always_inline)) static volatile FTFL_Type &ftfl() {
2325  return *(FTFL_Type *)baseAddress;
2326  }
2327 
2328  struct EepromSizes {
2329  const uint16_t size; // EEPROM size
2330  const uint8_t value; // Value to select size
2331  };
2332 
2333  /** EEPROM Data Set Size Field */
2334  static constexpr EepromSizes eepromSizes[] = {
2335  // Size Value
2336  { 32, 0x09, },
2337  { 64, 0x08, },
2338  { 128, 0x07, },
2339  { 256, 0x06, },
2340  { 512, 0x05, },
2341  { 1024, 0x04, },
2342  { 2048, 0x03, },
2343  };
2344 
2345  struct PartitionInformation {
2346  const uint32_t flashSize; //! Remaining data flash
2347  const uint32_t eeepromSize; //! Flash allocated to EEPROM backing store
2348  const uint8_t value; //! Partition value
2349  };
2350 
2351  /** Flash partition information */
2352  static constexpr PartitionInformation partitionInformation[] {
2353  // Flash Backing Value
2354  { 32*1024, 0*1024 , 0xFF},
2355  { 24*1024, 8*1024 , 0x01},
2356  { 16*1024, 16*1024, 0x0A},
2357  { 8*1024, 24*1024, 0x09},
2358  { 0*1024, 32*1024, 0x08},
2359  };
2360 
2361  /** Selects EEPROM size */
2362  enum EepromSel {
2363  EepromSel_32Bytes,
2364  EepromSel_64Bytes,
2365  EepromSel_128Bytes,
2366  EepromSel_256Bytes,
2367  EepromSel_512Bytes,
2368  EepromSel_1KBytes,
2369  EepromSel_2KBytes,
2370  };
2371 
2372  /** Selects division of FlexNVM between flash and EEPROM backing storage */
2373  enum PartitionSel {
2374  PartitionSel_flash32K_eeprom0K,
2375  PartitionSel_flash24K_eeprom8K,
2376  PartitionSel_flash16K_eeprom16K,
2377  PartitionSel_flash8K_eeprom24K,
2378  PartitionSel_flash0K_eeprom32K,
2379 
2380  // All EEPROM
2381  PartitionSel_flash0K_eeprom_all = PartitionSel_flash0K_eeprom32K,
2382  };
2383 
2384  /**
2385  * Selects division of the EEPROM
2386  * Not supported on this device
2387  */
2388  enum SplitSel {
2389  // Not supported
2390  SplitSel_disabled=0x30,
2391  };
2392 
2393  //! FlexNVM - EEPROM size
2394  static constexpr EepromSel eepromSel = EepromSel_2KBytes;
2395 
2396  //! FlexNVM - Flash EEPROM partition
2397  static constexpr PartitionSel partitionSel = PartitionSel_flash0K_eeprom32K;
2398 
2399  //! FlexNVM - EEPROM partition - not available
2400  static constexpr SplitSel partitionSplit = SplitSel_disabled;
2401 
2402  //! IRQ numbers for hardware
2403  static constexpr IRQn_Type irqNums[] = FTFL_IRQS;
2404 
2405  //! Number of IRQs for hardware
2406  static constexpr uint32_t irqCount = sizeof(irqNums)/sizeof(irqNums[0]);
2407 
2408  //! Class based callback handler has been installed in vector table
2409  static constexpr bool irqHandlerInstalled = 0;
2410 
2411  //! Default IRQ level
2412  static constexpr uint32_t irqLevel = 8;
2413 
2414  /**
2415  * Enable clock to Ftfl
2416  */
2417  static void enableClock() {
2418 #ifdef PCC
2419  PccInfo::enableFtflClock();
2420 #else
2421  SIM->SCGC6 |= SIM_SCGC6_FTFL_MASK;
2422 #endif
2423  }
2424 
2425  /**
2426  * Disable clock to Ftfl
2427  */
2428  static void disableClock() {
2429 #ifdef PCC
2430  PccInfo::disableFtflClock();
2431 #else
2432  SIM->SCGC6 &= ~SIM_SCGC6_FTFL_MASK;
2433 #endif
2434  }
2435 
2436 };
2437 
2438 /**
2439  * End group FTFL_Group
2440  * @}
2441  */
2442 /**
2443  * @addtogroup FTM_Group FTM, PWM, Input capture and Output compare
2444  * @brief Abstraction for PWM, Input capture and Output compare
2445  * @{
2446  */
2447 #define USBDM_FTM_IS_DEFINED
2448 /**
2449  * Peripheral information for FTM, PWM, Input capture and Output compare.
2450  *
2451  * This may include pin information, constants, register addresses, and default register values,
2452  * along with simple accessor functions.
2453  */
2454 class FtmInfo {
2455 public:
2456  // Template:ftm
2457 
2458  //! Base value for PCR (excluding MUX value)
2459  static constexpr uint32_t defaultPcrValue =
2460  PORT_PCR_LK(0) | // Lock Register
2461  PORT_PCR_DSE(0) | // Drive Strength Enable
2462  PORT_PCR_ODE(0) | // Open Drain Enable
2463  PORT_PCR_PFE(0) | // Passive Filter Enable
2464  PORT_PCR_SRE(0) | // Slew Rate Enable
2465  PORT_PCR_PS(0); // Pull device
2466 
2467  //! Number of signals available in info table
2468  static constexpr int numSignals = 2;
2469 
2470  //! Information for each signal of peripheral
2471  static constexpr PinInfo info[] = {
2472 
2473  // Signal Pin portInfo gpioAddress gpioBit PCR value
2474  /* 0: FTM_CLKIN0 = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
2475  /* 1: FTM_CLKIN1 = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
2476  };
2477 
2478  /**
2479  * Initialise pins used by peripheral
2480  *
2481  * @param pcrValue PCR value controlling pin options
2482  */
2483  static void initPCRs(uint32_t pcrValue=defaultPcrValue) {
2484  (void)pcrValue;
2485  }
2486 
2487  /**
2488  * Resets pins used by peripheral
2489  */
2490  static void clearPCRs() {
2491  }
2492 
2493 };
2494 
2495 #define USBDM_FTM0_IS_DEFINED
2496 /**
2497  * Peripheral information for FTM, PWM, Input capture and Output compare.
2498  *
2499  * This may include pin information, constants, register addresses, and default register values,
2500  * along with simple accessor functions.
2501  */
2502 class Ftm0Info {
2503 public:
2504  // Template:ftm0_8ch
2505 
2506  //! Map all allocated pins on a peripheral when enabled
2507  static constexpr bool mapPinsOnEnable = false;
2508 
2509  //! Number of channels implemented
2510  static constexpr unsigned NumChannels = 8;
2511 
2512  //! Number of channel event vectors implemented
2513  static constexpr unsigned NumChannelVectors = 1;
2514 
2515  //! Hardware base address as uint32_t
2516  static constexpr uint32_t baseAddress = FTM0_BasePtr;
2517 
2518  //! Hardware base pointer
2519  __attribute__((always_inline)) static volatile FTM_Type &ftm() {
2520  return *(FTM_Type *)baseAddress;
2521  }
2522 
2523  //! Base value for PCR (excluding MUX value)
2524  static constexpr uint32_t defaultPcrValue =
2525  PORT_PCR_LK(0) | // Lock Register
2526  PORT_PCR_DSE(0) | // Drive Strength Enable
2527  PORT_PCR_ODE(0) | // Open Drain Enable
2528  PORT_PCR_PFE(0) | // Passive Filter Enable
2529  PORT_PCR_SRE(0) | // Slew Rate Enable
2530  PORT_PCR_PS(0); // Pull device
2531 
2532  //! Timer external input frequency
2533  static constexpr uint32_t ftmExternalClock = 0;
2534 
2535  //! Default Timer Modulo
2536  static constexpr uint32_t modulo = FTM_MOD_MOD(10000);
2537 
2538  //! Default value for SC register
2539  static constexpr uint32_t sc =
2540  FTM_SC_CPWMS(0)| // Centre-Aligned PWM Select
2541  FTM_SC_CLKS(1)| // Clock Mode Selection
2542  FTM_SC_TOIE(0)| // Timer Overflow Interrupt Enable
2543  FTM_SC_PS(0); // Prescale Factor Selection
2544 
2545  //! Default value for EXTTRIG) register
2546  static constexpr uint32_t exttrig =
2547  0x0| // External Trigger Enable
2548  FTM_EXTTRIG_INITTRIGEN(0); // Initialization Trigger Enable
2549 
2550  //! IRQ numbers for hardware
2551  static constexpr IRQn_Type irqNums[] = FTM0_IRQS;
2552 
2553  //! Number of IRQs for hardware
2554  static constexpr uint32_t irqCount = sizeof(irqNums)/sizeof(irqNums[0]);
2555 
2556  //! Class based callback handler has been installed in vector table
2557  static constexpr bool irqHandlerInstalled = 0;
2558 
2559  //! Default IRQ level
2560  static constexpr uint32_t irqLevel = 8;
2561 
2562  /** Minimum resolution for PWM interval */
2563  static constexpr uint32_t minimumResolution=1?100:0;
2564 
2565  /** Minimum usable interval in ticks */
2566  static constexpr uint32_t minimumInterval=1?20:0;
2567 
2568  /**
2569  * Get input clock frequency
2570  *
2571  * @return Input clock frequency as a uint32_t in Hz
2572  */
2573  static uint32_t getInputClockFrequency() {
2574 
2575  switch(ftm().SC&FTM_SC_CLKS_MASK) {
2576  default:
2577  case FTM_SC_CLKS(0): return 0;
2578  case FTM_SC_CLKS(1): return SystemBusClock;
2579  case FTM_SC_CLKS(2): return SystemMcgffClock;
2580  case FTM_SC_CLKS(3): return ftmExternalClock;
2581  }
2582  }
2583 
2584  /**
2585  * Enable clock to Ftm0
2586  */
2587  static void enableClock() {
2588 #ifdef PCC
2589  PccInfo::enableFtm0Clock();
2590 #else
2591  SIM->SCGC6 |= SIM_SCGC6_FTM0_MASK;
2592 #endif
2593  }
2594 
2595  /**
2596  * Disable clock to Ftm0
2597  */
2598  static void disableClock() {
2599 #ifdef PCC
2600  PccInfo::disableFtm0Clock();
2601 #else
2602  SIM->SCGC6 &= ~SIM_SCGC6_FTM0_MASK;
2603 #endif
2604  }
2605 
2606  //! Number of signals available in info table
2607  static constexpr int numSignals = 8;
2608 
2609  //! Information for each signal of peripheral
2610  static constexpr PinInfo info[] = {
2611 
2612  // Signal Pin portInfo gpioAddress gpioBit PCR value
2613  /* 0: FTM0_CH0 = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
2614  /* 1: FTM0_CH1 = PTA4 (D21) */ { PortAInfo, GPIOA_BasePtr, 4, PORT_PCR_MUX(3)|defaultPcrValue },
2615  /* 2: FTM0_CH2 = PTC3 (D6/LED_RED) */ { PortCInfo, GPIOC_BasePtr, 3, PORT_PCR_MUX(4)|defaultPcrValue },
2616  /* 3: FTM0_CH3 = PTC4 (D7) */ { PortCInfo, GPIOC_BasePtr, 4, PORT_PCR_MUX(4)|defaultPcrValue },
2617  /* 4: FTM0_CH4 = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
2618  /* 5: FTM0_CH5 = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
2619  /* 6: FTM0_CH6 = PTA1 (D5) */ { PortAInfo, GPIOA_BasePtr, 1, PORT_PCR_MUX(3)|defaultPcrValue },
2620  /* 7: FTM0_CH7 = PTA2 (D9/LED_BLUE) */ { PortAInfo, GPIOA_BasePtr, 2, PORT_PCR_MUX(3)|defaultPcrValue },
2621  };
2622 
2623  /**
2624  * Initialise pins used by peripheral
2625  *
2626  * @param pcrValue PCR value controlling pin options
2627  */
2628  static void initPCRs(uint32_t pcrValue=defaultPcrValue) {
2629 #ifdef PCC_PCCn_CGC_MASK
2630  PCC->PCC_PORTA = PCC_PCCn_CGC_MASK;
2631  PCC->PCC_PORTC = PCC_PCCn_CGC_MASK;
2632 #else
2633  enablePortClocks(PORTA_CLOCK_MASK|PORTC_CLOCK_MASK);
2634 #endif
2635  PORTA->GPCLR = pcrValue|PORT_PCR_MUX(3)|PORT_GPCLR_GPWE(0x0016UL);
2636  PORTC->GPCLR = pcrValue|PORT_PCR_MUX(4)|PORT_GPCLR_GPWE(0x0018UL);
2637  }
2638 
2639  /**
2640  * Resets pins used by peripheral
2641  */
2642  static void clearPCRs() {
2643 #ifdef PCC_PCCn_CGC_MASK
2644  PCC->PCC_PORTA = PCC_PCCn_CGC_MASK;
2645  PCC->PCC_PORTC = PCC_PCCn_CGC_MASK;
2646 #else
2647  enablePortClocks(PORTA_CLOCK_MASK|PORTC_CLOCK_MASK);
2648 #endif
2649  PORTA->GPCLR = PORT_PCR_MUX(0)|PORT_GPCLR_GPWE(0x16U);
2650  PORTC->GPCLR = PORT_PCR_MUX(0)|PORT_GPCLR_GPWE(0x18U);
2651  }
2652 
2653 #define USBDM_FTM0_INFOFAULT_IS_DEFINED
2654  class InfoFAULT {
2655  public:
2656  //! Number of signals available in info table
2657  static constexpr int numSignals = 4;
2658 
2659  //! Information for each signal of peripheral
2660  static constexpr PinInfo info[] = {
2661 
2662  // Signal Pin portInfo gpioAddress gpioBit PCR value
2663  /* 0: FTM0_FLT0 = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
2664  /* 1: FTM0_FLT1 = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
2665  /* 2: FTM0_FLT2 = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
2666  /* 3: FTM0_FLT3 = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
2667  };
2668 
2669  /**
2670  * Initialise pins used by peripheral
2671  *
2672  * @param pcrValue PCR value controlling pin options
2673  */
2674  static void initPCRs(uint32_t pcrValue=defaultPcrValue) {
2675  (void)pcrValue;
2676  }
2677 
2678  /**
2679  * Resets pins used by peripheral
2680  */
2681  static void clearPCRs() {
2682  }
2683 
2684  };
2685 
2686 };
2687 
2688 #define USBDM_FTM1_IS_DEFINED
2689 /**
2690  * Peripheral information for FTM, PWM, Input capture and Output compare.
2691  *
2692  * This may include pin information, constants, register addresses, and default register values,
2693  * along with simple accessor functions.
2694  */
2695 class Ftm1Info {
2696 public:
2697  // Template:ftm1_2ch
2698 
2699  //! Map all allocated pins on a peripheral when enabled
2700  static constexpr bool mapPinsOnEnable = false;
2701 
2702  //! Number of channels implemented
2703  static constexpr unsigned NumChannels = 2;
2704 
2705  //! Number of channel event vectors implemented
2706  static constexpr unsigned NumChannelVectors = 1;
2707 
2708  //! Hardware base address as uint32_t
2709  static constexpr uint32_t baseAddress = FTM1_BasePtr;
2710 
2711  //! Hardware base pointer
2712  __attribute__((always_inline)) static volatile FTM_Type &ftm() {
2713  return *(FTM_Type *)baseAddress;
2714  }
2715 
2716  //! Base value for PCR (excluding MUX value)
2717  static constexpr uint32_t defaultPcrValue =
2718  PORT_PCR_LK(0) | // Lock Register
2719  PORT_PCR_DSE(0) | // Drive Strength Enable
2720  PORT_PCR_ODE(0) | // Open Drain Enable
2721  PORT_PCR_PFE(0) | // Passive Filter Enable
2722  PORT_PCR_SRE(0) | // Slew Rate Enable
2723  PORT_PCR_PS(0); // Pull device
2724 
2725  //! Timer external input frequency
2726  static constexpr uint32_t ftmExternalClock = 0;
2727 
2728  //! Default Timer Modulo
2729  static constexpr uint32_t modulo = FTM_MOD_MOD(10000);
2730 
2731  //! Default value for SC register
2732  static constexpr uint32_t sc =
2733  FTM_SC_CPWMS(0)| // Centre-Aligned PWM Select
2734  FTM_SC_CLKS(1)| // Clock Mode Selection
2735  FTM_SC_TOIE(0)| // Timer Overflow Interrupt Enable
2736  FTM_SC_PS(0); // Prescale Factor Selection
2737 
2738  //! Default value for EXTTRIG) register
2739  static constexpr uint32_t exttrig =
2740  0x0| // External Trigger Enable
2741  FTM_EXTTRIG_INITTRIGEN(0); // Initialization Trigger Enable
2742 
2743  //! IRQ numbers for hardware
2744  static constexpr IRQn_Type irqNums[] = FTM1_IRQS;
2745 
2746  //! Number of IRQs for hardware
2747  static constexpr uint32_t irqCount = sizeof(irqNums)/sizeof(irqNums[0]);
2748 
2749  //! Class based callback handler has been installed in vector table
2750  static constexpr bool irqHandlerInstalled = 0;
2751 
2752  //! Default IRQ level
2753  static constexpr uint32_t irqLevel = 8;
2754 
2755  /** Minimum resolution for PWM interval */
2756  static constexpr uint32_t minimumResolution=1?100:0;
2757 
2758  /** Minimum usable interval in ticks */
2759  static constexpr uint32_t minimumInterval=1?20:0;
2760 
2761  /**
2762  * Get input clock frequency
2763  *
2764  * @return Input clock frequency as a uint32_t in Hz
2765  */
2766  static uint32_t getInputClockFrequency() {
2767 
2768  switch(ftm().SC&FTM_SC_CLKS_MASK) {
2769  default:
2770  case FTM_SC_CLKS(0): return 0;
2771  case FTM_SC_CLKS(1): return SystemBusClock;
2772  case FTM_SC_CLKS(2): return SystemMcgffClock;
2773  case FTM_SC_CLKS(3): return ftmExternalClock;
2774  }
2775  }
2776 
2777  /**
2778  * Enable clock to Ftm1
2779  */
2780  static void enableClock() {
2781 #ifdef PCC
2782  PccInfo::enableFtm1Clock();
2783 #else
2784  SIM->SCGC6 |= SIM_SCGC6_FTM1_MASK;
2785 #endif
2786  }
2787 
2788  /**
2789  * Disable clock to Ftm1
2790  */
2791  static void disableClock() {
2792 #ifdef PCC
2793  PccInfo::disableFtm1Clock();
2794 #else
2795  SIM->SCGC6 &= ~SIM_SCGC6_FTM1_MASK;
2796 #endif
2797  }
2798 
2799  //! Number of signals available in info table
2800  static constexpr int numSignals = 2;
2801 
2802  //! Information for each signal of peripheral
2803  static constexpr PinInfo info[] = {
2804 
2805  // Signal Pin portInfo gpioAddress gpioBit PCR value
2806  /* 0: FTM1_CH0 = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
2807  /* 1: FTM1_CH1 = PTA13 (D24) */ { PortAInfo, GPIOA_BasePtr, 13, PORT_PCR_MUX(3)|defaultPcrValue },
2808  };
2809 
2810  /**
2811  * Initialise pins used by peripheral
2812  *
2813  * @param pcrValue PCR value controlling pin options
2814  */
2815  static void initPCRs(uint32_t pcrValue=defaultPcrValue) {
2816 #ifdef PCC_PCCn_CGC_MASK
2817  PCC->PCC_PORTA = PCC_PCCn_CGC_MASK;
2818 #else
2819  enablePortClocks(PORTA_CLOCK_MASK);
2820 #endif
2821  PORTA->GPCLR = pcrValue|PORT_PCR_MUX(3)|PORT_GPCLR_GPWE(0x2000UL);
2822  }
2823 
2824  /**
2825  * Resets pins used by peripheral
2826  */
2827  static void clearPCRs() {
2828 #ifdef PCC_PCCn_CGC_MASK
2829  PCC->PCC_PORTA = PCC_PCCn_CGC_MASK;
2830 #else
2831  enablePortClocks(PORTA_CLOCK_MASK);
2832 #endif
2833  PORTA->GPCLR = PORT_PCR_MUX(0)|PORT_GPCLR_GPWE(0x2000U);
2834  }
2835 
2836 #define USBDM_FTM1_INFOFAULT_IS_DEFINED

2844

2846  /* 0: FTM1_FLT0 = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
2847  };

2850  * Initialise pins used by peripheral
2851  *
2852  * @param pcrValue PCR value controlling pin options
2853  */

2855  (void)pcrValue;
2856  }
2857

2859  * Resets pins used by peripheral
2860  */
2861  static void clearPCRs() {
2862  }
2863 
2864  };

2903 /**

2906  * @{
2907  */
2908 #define USBDM_GPIOA_IS_DEFINED
2909 /**
2910  * Peripheral information for GPIO, Digital Input/Output.
2911  *
2912  * This may include pin information, constants, register addresses, and default register values,
2913  * along with simple accessor functions.
2914  */
2915 class GpioAInfo {
2916 public:
2917  // Template:gpioa_0x400ff000
2918 
2919  //! Describes the port/gpio
2920  static constexpr PinInfo pinInfo { PortAInfo, GPIOA_BasePtr, 0, GPIO_DEFAULT_PCR };
2921 
2922  //! Class based callback handler has been installed in vector table
2923  static constexpr bool irqHandlerInstalled = 0;
2924 
2925  //! Default IRQ level
2926  static constexpr uint32_t irqLevel = 8;
2927 
2928 };

3022 /**
3023  * @addtogroup I2C_Group I2C, Inter-Integrated-Circuit Interface
3024  * @brief Abstraction for Inter-Integrated-Circuit Interface
3025  * @{
3026  */
3027 #define USBDM_I2C0_IS_DEFINED
3028 /**
3029  * Peripheral information for I2C, Inter-Integrated-Circuit Interface.
3030  *
3031  * This may include pin information, constants, register addresses, and default register values,
3032  * along with simple accessor functions.
3033  */
3034 class I2c0Info {
3035 public:
3036  // Template:i2c0_mk10d5
3037 
3038  //! Hardware base address as uint32_t
3039  static constexpr uint32_t baseAddress = I2C0_BasePtr;
3040 
3041  //! Hardware base pointer
3042  __attribute__((always_inline)) static volatile I2C_Type &i2c() {
3043  return *(I2C_Type *)baseAddress;
3044  }
3045 
3046  //! Base value for PCR (excluding MUX value)
3047  static constexpr uint32_t defaultPcrValue = I2C_DEFAULT_PCR;
3048 
3049  //! Map all allocated pins on a peripheral when enabled
3050  static constexpr bool mapPinsOnEnable = true;
3051 
3052  //! IRQ numbers for hardware
3053  static constexpr IRQn_Type irqNums[] = I2C0_IRQS;
3054 
3055  //! Number of IRQs for hardware
3056  static constexpr uint32_t irqCount = sizeof(irqNums)/sizeof(irqNums[0]);
3057 
3058  //! Class based callback handler has been installed in vector table
3059  static constexpr bool irqHandlerInstalled = 0;
3060 
3061  //! Default IRQ level
3062  static constexpr uint32_t irqLevel = 8;
3063 
3064  /**
3065  * Get input clock frequency
3066  *
3067  * @return Input clock frequency as a uint32_t in Hz
3068  */
3069  static uint32_t getInputClockFrequency() {
3070  return SystemBusClock;
3071  }
3072 
3073  /**
3074  * Enable clock to I2c0
3075  */
3076  static void enableClock() {
3077 #ifdef PCC
3078  PccInfo::enableI2c0Clock();
3079 #else
3080  SIM->SCGC4 |= SIM_SCGC4_I2C0_MASK;
3081 #endif
3082  }
3083 
3084  /**
3085  * Disable clock to I2c0
3086  */
3087  static void disableClock() {
3088 #ifdef PCC
3089  PccInfo::disableI2c0Clock();
3090 #else
3091  SIM->SCGC4 &= ~SIM_SCGC4_I2C0_MASK;
3092 #endif
3093  }
3094 
3095  //! Number of signals available in info table
3096  static constexpr int numSignals = 2;
3097 
3098  //! Information for each signal of peripheral
3099  static constexpr PinInfo info[] = {
3100 
3101  // Signal Pin portInfo gpioAddress gpioBit PCR value
3102  /* 0: I2C0_SCL = PTB0 (A5/ACC_SCL) */ { PortBInfo, GPIOB_BasePtr, 0, PORT_PCR_MUX(2)|defaultPcrValue },
3103  /* 1: I2C0_SDA = PTB1 (A4/ACC_SDA) */ { PortBInfo, GPIOB_BasePtr, 1, PORT_PCR_MUX(2)|defaultPcrValue },
3104  };
3105 
3106  /**
3107  * Initialise pins used by peripheral
3108  *
3109  * @param pcrValue PCR value controlling pin options
3110  */
3111  static void initPCRs(uint32_t pcrValue=defaultPcrValue) {
3112 #ifdef PCC_PCCn_CGC_MASK
3113  PCC->PCC_PORTB = PCC_PCCn_CGC_MASK;
3114 #else
3115  enablePortClocks(PORTB_CLOCK_MASK);
3116 #endif
3117  PORTB->GPCLR = pcrValue|PORT_PCR_MUX(2)|PORT_GPCLR_GPWE(0x0003UL);
3118  }
3119 
3120  /**
3121  * Resets pins used by peripheral
3122  */
3123  static void clearPCRs() {
3124 #ifdef PCC_PCCn_CGC_MASK
3125  PCC->PCC_PORTB = PCC_PCCn_CGC_MASK;
3126 #else
3127  enablePortClocks(PORTB_CLOCK_MASK);
3128 #endif
3129  PORTB->GPCLR = PORT_PCR_MUX(0)|PORT_GPCLR_GPWE(0x3U);
3130  }
3131 
3132 };
3133 
3134 /**
3135  * End group I2C_Group
3136  * @}
3137  */
3138 /**
3139  * @addtogroup I2S_Group I2S, Synchronous Audio Interface
3140  * @brief Abstraction for Synchronous Audio Interface
3141  * @{
3142  */
3143 #define USBDM_I2S0_IS_DEFINED
3144 /**
3145  * Peripheral information for I2S, Synchronous Audio Interface.
3146  *
3147  * This may include pin information, constants, register addresses, and default register values,
3148  * along with simple accessor functions.
3149  */
3150 class I2s0Info {
3151 public:
3152  // Template:i2s0_2ch
3153

3155  static constexpr uint32_t baseAddress = I2S0_BasePtr;
3156 
3157  //! Hardware base pointer
3158  __attribute__((always_inline)) static volatile I2S_Type &i2s() {
3159  return *(I2S_Type *)baseAddress;
3160  }
3161 
3162  //! Base value for PCR (excluding MUX value)
3163  static constexpr uint32_t defaultPcrValue = I2S_DEFAULT_PCR;
3164 
3165  //! Map all allocated pins on a peripheral when enabled
3166  static constexpr bool mapPinsOnEnable = true;
3167 
3168  //! IRQ numbers for hardware
3169  static constexpr IRQn_Type irqNums[] = I2S0_IRQS;
3170 
3171  //! Number of IRQs for hardware
3172  static constexpr uint32_t irqCount = sizeof(irqNums)/sizeof(irqNums[0]);
3173 
3174  //! Class based callback handler has been installed in vector table
3175  static constexpr bool irqHandlerInstalled = 0;
3176

3178  * Enable clock to I2s0
3179  */
3180  static void enableClock() {
3181 #ifdef PCC
3182  PccInfo::enableI2s0Clock();
3183 #else
3184  SIM->SCGC6 |= SIM_SCGC6_I2S_MASK;
3185 #endif
3186  }
3187 
3188  /**
3189  * Disable clock to I2s0
3190  */
3191  static void disableClock() {
3192 #ifdef PCC
3193  PccInfo::disableI2s0Clock();
3194 #else
3195  SIM->SCGC6 &= ~SIM_SCGC6_I2S_MASK;
3196 #endif
3197  }
3198 
3199  //! Number of signals available in info table
3200  static constexpr int numSignals = 8;
3201 
3202  //! Information for each signal of peripheral
3203  static constexpr PinInfo info[] = {
3204 
3205  // Signal Pin portInfo gpioAddress gpioBit PCR value
3206  /* 0: I2S0_MCLK = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
3207  /* 1: I2S0_RX_BCLK = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
3208  /* 2: I2S0_RX_FS = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
3209  /* 3: I2S0_TX_BCLK = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
3210  /* 4: I2S0_TX_FS = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
3211  /* 5: I2S0_TXD0 = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
3212  /* 6: -- = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, INVALID_PCR, 0 },
3213  /* 7: I2S0_RXD0 = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
3214  };
3215 
3216  /**
3217  * Initialise pins used by peripheral
3218  *
3219  * @param pcrValue PCR value controlling pin options
3220  */
3221  static void initPCRs(uint32_t pcrValue=defaultPcrValue) {
3222  (void)pcrValue;
3223  }
3224 
3225  /**
3226  * Resets pins used by peripheral
3227  */
3228  static void clearPCRs() {
3229  }
3230 
3231 };

3233 /**
3234  * End group I2S_Group
3235  * @}
3236  */
3237 /**
3238  * @addtogroup LLWU_Group LLWU, Low-leakage Wake-up Unit
3239  * @brief Abstraction for Low-leakage Wake-up Unit
3240  * @{
3241  */
3242 #define USBDM_LLWU_IS_DEFINED
3243 /**
3244  * Peripheral information for LLWU, Low-leakage Wake-up Unit.
3245  *
3246  * This may include pin information, constants, register addresses, and default register values,
3247  * along with simple accessor functions.
3248  */
3249 class LlwuInfo {
3250 public:
3251  // Template:llwu_pe4_filt2_rst_mk20d5
3252 
3253  // Module wake ups
3254  static constexpr uint8_t me =
3255  LLWU_ME_WUME0(0) | // LPTMR
3256  LLWU_ME_WUME1(0) | // CMP0
3257  LLWU_ME_WUME2(0) | // CMP1
3258  LLWU_ME_WUME3(0) | // CMP2/3 (if present)
3259  LLWU_ME_WUME4(0) | // TSI0 (if present)
3260  LLWU_ME_WUME5(0) | // RTC Alarm
3261  LLWU_ME_WUME6(0) | //
3262  LLWU_ME_WUME7(0); // RTC Seconds
3263 
3264  //! Hardware base address as uint32_t
3265  static constexpr uint32_t baseAddress = LLWU_BasePtr;
3266 
3267  //! Hardware base pointer
3268  __attribute__((always_inline)) static volatile LLWU_Type &llwu() {
3269  return *(LLWU_Type *)baseAddress;
3270  }
3271 
3272  //! Base value for PCR (excluding MUX value)
3273  static constexpr uint32_t defaultPcrValue =
3274  PORT_PCR_LK(0) | // Lock Register
3275  PORT_PCR_DSE(0) | // Drive Strength Enable
3276  PORT_PCR_ODE(0) | // Open Drain Enable
3277  PORT_PCR_PFE(0) | // Passive Filter Enable
3278  PORT_PCR_SRE(0) | // Slew Rate Enable
3279  PORT_PCR_PS(0); // Pull device
3280 
3281  //! Map all allocated pins on a peripheral when enabled
3282  static constexpr bool mapPinsOnEnable = false;
3283 
3284  // LLWU Pin Enable registers
3285  static constexpr uint8_t pe1 =
3286  LLWU_PE1_WUPE0(0)| // LLWUP 0
3287  LLWU_PE1_WUPE1(0)| // LLWUP 1
3288  LLWU_PE1_WUPE2(0)| // LLWUP 2
3289  LLWU_PE1_WUPE3(0); // LLWUP 3
3290 
3291  static constexpr uint8_t pe2 =
3292  LLWU_PE2_WUPE4(0)| // LLWUP 4
3293  LLWU_PE2_WUPE5(0)| // LLWUP 5
3294  LLWU_PE2_WUPE6(0)| // LLWUP 6
3295  LLWU_PE2_WUPE7(0); // LLWUP 7
3296 
3297  static constexpr uint8_t pe3 =
3298  LLWU_PE3_WUPE8(0)| // LLWUP 8
3299  LLWU_PE3_WUPE9(0)| // LLWUP 9
3300  LLWU_PE3_WUPE10(0)| // LLWUP 10
3301  LLWU_PE3_WUPE11(0); // LLWUP 11
3302 
3303  static constexpr uint8_t pe4 =
3304  LLWU_PE4_WUPE12(0)| // LLWUP 12
3305  LLWU_PE4_WUPE13(0)| // LLWUP 13
3306  LLWU_PE4_WUPE14(0)| // LLWUP 14
3307  LLWU_PE4_WUPE15(0); // LLWUP 15
3308 
3309  // Pin Filter 1 register
3310  static constexpr uint8_t filt1 =
3311  LLWU_FILT_FILTE(0) | // Digital Filter On External Pin
3312  LLWU_FILT_FILTSEL(0); // Filter Pin Select
3313 
3314  // Pin Filter 2 register
3315  static constexpr uint8_t filt2 =
3316  LLWU_FILT_FILTE(0) | // Digital Filter On External Pin
3317  LLWU_FILT_FILTSEL(0); // Filter Pin Select
3318 
3319  // LLWU Reset Enable register
3320  static constexpr uint8_t rst =
3321  LLWU_RST_LLRSTE(1) | // Low-Leakage Mode RESET Enable
3322  LLWU_RST_RSTFILT(0); // Digital Filter On RESET Pin
3323 
3324  //! IRQ numbers for hardware
3325  static constexpr IRQn_Type irqNums[] = LLWU_IRQS;
3326 
3327  //! Number of IRQs for hardware
3328  static constexpr uint32_t irqCount = sizeof(irqNums)/sizeof(irqNums[0]);
3329 
3330  //! Class based callback handler has been installed in vector table
3331  static constexpr bool irqHandlerInstalled = 0;
3332 
3333  //! Default IRQ level
3334  static constexpr uint32_t irqLevel = 8;
3335 
3336  //! Number of signals available in info table
3337  static constexpr int numSignals = 16;
3338 
3339  //! Information for each signal of peripheral
3340  static constexpr PinInfo info[] = {
3341 
3342  // Signal Pin portInfo gpioAddress gpioBit PCR value
3343  /* 0: LLWU_P0 = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
3344  /* 1: -- = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, INVALID_PCR, 0 },
3345  /* 2: -- = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, INVALID_PCR, 0 },
3346  /* 3: LLWU_P3 = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
3347  /* 4: LLWU_P4 = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
3348  /* 5: LLWU_P5 = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
3349  /* 6: LLWU_P6 = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
3350  /* 7: LLWU_P7 = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
3351  /* 8: LLWU_P8 = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
3352  /* 9: LLWU_P9 = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
3353  /* 10: LLWU_P10 = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
3354  /* 11: LLWU_P11 = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
3355  /* 12: LLWU_P12 = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
3356  /* 13: LLWU_P13 = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
3357  /* 14: LLWU_P14 = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
3358  /* 15: LLWU_P15 = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },

3381  */
3382 /**
3383  * @addtogroup LPTMR_Group LPTMR, Low Power Timer
3384  * @brief Abstraction for Low Power Timer
3385  * @{
3386  */
3387 #define USBDM_LPTMR0_IS_DEFINED
3388 /**
3389  * Peripheral information for LPTMR, Low Power Timer.
3390  *
3391  * This may include pin information, constants, register addresses, and default register values,
3392  * along with simple accessor functions.
3393  */
3394 class Lptmr0Info {
3395 public:
3396  // Template:lptmr0
3397 
3398  //! Hardware base address as uint32_t
3399  static constexpr uint32_t baseAddress = LPTMR0_BasePtr;
3400 
3401  //! Hardware base pointer
3402  __attribute__((always_inline)) static volatile LPTMR_Type &lptmr() {
3403  return *(LPTMR_Type *)baseAddress;
3404  }
3405 
3406  //! Base value for PCR (excluding MUX value)
3407  static constexpr uint32_t defaultPcrValue =
3408  PORT_PCR_LK(0) | // Lock Register
3409  PORT_PCR_DSE(0) | // Drive Strength Enable
3410  PORT_PCR_ODE(0) | // Open Drain Enable
3411  PORT_PCR_PFE(0) | // Passive Filter Enable
3412  PORT_PCR_SRE(0) | // Slew Rate Enable
3413  PORT_PCR_PS(0); // Pull device
3414 
3415  //! Map all allocated pins on a peripheral when enabled
3416  static constexpr bool mapPinsOnEnable = false;
3417 
3418  //! Default Timer Compare value
3419  static constexpr uint32_t cmr = 65535;
3420 
3421  //! Default PSR value
3422  static constexpr uint32_t psr =
3423  LPTMR_PSR_PRESCALE(0)|
3424  LPTMR_PSR_PBYP(0)|
3425  LPTMR_PSR_PCS(0);
3426 
3427  //! Default CSR value
3428  static constexpr uint32_t csr =
3429  LPTMR_CSR_TIE(0)|
3430  LPTMR_CSR_TMS(0)|
3431  LPTMR_CSR_TFC(0)|
3432  LPTMR_CSR_TPP(0)|
3433  LPTMR_CSR_TPS(0);
3434 
3435  //! IRQ numbers for hardware
3436  static constexpr IRQn_Type irqNums[] = LPTMR0_IRQS;
3437 
3438  //! Number of IRQs for hardware
3439  static constexpr uint32_t irqCount = sizeof(irqNums)/sizeof(irqNums[0]);
3440 
3441  //! Class based callback handler has been installed in vector table
3442  static constexpr bool irqHandlerInstalled = 0;
3443 
3444  //! Default IRQ level
3445  static constexpr uint32_t irqLevel = 8;
3446 
3447  /**
3448  * Get input clock frequency
3449  *
3450  * @return Input clock frequency as an uint32_t in Hz
3451  */
3452  static uint32_t getInputClockFrequency() {
3453 
3454  switch(lptmr().PSR&LPTMR_PSR_PCS_MASK) {
3455  default:
3456  case LPTMR_PSR_PCS(0): return McgInfo::getMcgIrClock();
3457  case LPTMR_PSR_PCS(1): return SystemLpoClock;
3458  case LPTMR_PSR_PCS(2): return SimInfo::getErc32kClock();
3459  case LPTMR_PSR_PCS(3): return Osc0Info::getOscerClock();
3460  }
3461  }
3462 
3463  /**
3464  * Get clock frequency
3465  *
3466  * @return Frequency as a float in Hz
3467  */
3468  static float getClockFrequencyF() {
3469 
3470  float freq = getInputClockFrequency();
3471  if (lptmr().PSR&LPTMR_PSR_PBYP_MASK) {
3472  return freq;
3473  }
3474  return freq/(1<<(((lptmr().PSR&LPTMR_PSR_PRESCALE_MASK)>>LPTMR_PSR_PRESCALE_SHIFT)+1));
3475  }
3476 
3477  /**
3478  * Get clock frequency
3479  *
3480  * @return Frequency as a uint32_t in Hz (may underflow)
3481  */
3482  static uint32_t getClockFrequency() {
3483 
3484  uint32_t freq = getInputClockFrequency();
3485  if (lptmr().PSR&LPTMR_PSR_PBYP_MASK) {
3486  return freq;
3487  }
3488  return freq/(1<<(((lptmr().PSR&LPTMR_PSR_PRESCALE_MASK)>>LPTMR_PSR_PRESCALE_SHIFT)+1));
3489  }
3490 
3491  /**
3492  * Enable clock to Lptmr0
3493  */
3494  static void enableClock() {
3495 #ifdef PCC
3496  PccInfo::enableLptmr0Clock();
3497 #else
3498  SIM->SCGC5 |= SIM_SCGC5_LPTMR_MASK;
3499 #endif
3500  }
3501 
3502  /**
3503  * Disable clock to Lptmr0
3504  */
3505  static void disableClock() {
3506 #ifdef PCC
3507  PccInfo::disableLptmr0Clock();
3508 #else
3509  SIM->SCGC5 &= ~SIM_SCGC5_LPTMR_MASK;
3510 #endif
3511  }
3512 
3513  //! Number of signals available in info table
3514  static constexpr int numSignals = 3;
3515 
3516  //! Information for each signal of peripheral
3517  static constexpr PinInfo info[] = {
3518 
3519  // Signal Pin portInfo gpioAddress gpioBit PCR value
3520  /* 0: -- = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, INVALID_PCR, 0 },
3521  /* 1: LPTMR0_ALT1 = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
3522  /* 2: LPTMR0_ALT2 = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
3523  };
3524 
3525  /**
3526  * Initialise pins used by peripheral
3527  *
3528  * @param pcrValue PCR value controlling pin options
3529  */
3530  static void initPCRs(uint32_t pcrValue=defaultPcrValue) {
3531  (void)pcrValue;
3532  }
3533 
3534  /**
3535  * Resets pins used by peripheral
3536  */
3537  static void clearPCRs() {
3538  }
3539 
3540 };
3541 
3542 /**
3543  * End group LPTMR_Group
3544  * @}
3545  */
3546 /**
3547  * @addtogroup MCM_Group MCM, Miscellaneous Control Module
3548  * @brief Abstraction for Miscellaneous Control Module
3549  * @{
3550  */
3551 #define USBDM_MCM_IS_DEFINED
3552 /**
3553  * Peripheral information for MCM, Miscellaneous Control Module.
3554  *
3555  * This may include pin information, constants, register addresses, and default register values,
3556  * along with simple accessor functions.
3557  */
3558 class McmInfo {
3559 public:
3560  // Template:mcm_mk11d5
3561

3563  static constexpr uint32_t baseAddress = MCM_BasePtr;
3564

3568  }

3571 
3572 /**
3573  * End group MCM_Group
3574  * @}
3575  */
3576 /**
3577  * @addtogroup PDB_Group PDB, Programmable Delay Block
3578  * @brief Abstraction for Programmable Delay Block
3579  * @{
3580  */
3581 #define USBDM_PDB0_IS_DEFINED
3582 /**
3583  * Peripheral information for PDB, Programmable Delay Block.
3584  *
3585  * This may include pin information, constants, register addresses, and default register values,
3586  * along with simple accessor functions.
3587  */
3588 class Pdb0Info {
3589 public:
3590  // Template:pdb0_1ch_2pt_0dac_2po
3591 
3592  //! Hardware base address as uint32_t
3593  static constexpr uint32_t baseAddress = PDB0_BasePtr;
3594 
3595  //! Hardware base pointer
3596  __attribute__((always_inline)) static volatile PDB_Type &pdb() {
3597  return *(PDB_Type *)baseAddress;
3598  }
3599 
3600  //! Base value for PCR (excluding MUX value)
3601  static constexpr uint32_t defaultPcrValue =
3602  PORT_PCR_LK(0) | // Lock Register
3603  PORT_PCR_DSE(0) | // Drive Strength Enable
3604  PORT_PCR_ODE(0) | // Open Drain Enable
3605  PORT_PCR_PFE(0) | // Passive Filter Enable
3606  PORT_PCR_SRE(0) | // Slew Rate Enable
3607  PORT_PCR_PS(0); // Pull device
3608 
3609  //! Map all allocated pins on a peripheral when enabled
3610  static constexpr bool mapPinsOnEnable = false;
3611 
3612  static constexpr uint32_t pdb_sc =
3613  PDB_SC_MULT(0) | // Multiplication Factor Select for Prescaler
3614  PDB_SC_PDBIE(0) | // Interrupt Enable
3615  PDB_SC_TRGSEL(0) | // Trigger Input Source Select
3616  PDB_SC_PRESCALER(0) | // Prescaler Divider Select
3617  PDB_SC_DMAEN(0) | // DMA Enable
3618  PDB_SC_CONT(0) | // Continuous Mode Enable
3619  PDB_SC_PDBEIE(0) | // Sequence Error Interrupt Enable
3620  PDB_SC_LDMOD(0); // Load Mode Select
3621 
3622  static constexpr uint32_t pdb_mod =
3623  PDB_MOD_MOD(65535); // PDB Modulus
3624 
3625  static constexpr uint32_t pdb_idly =
3626  PDB_IDLY_IDLY(0); // Counter Modulus
3627 
3628  struct PdbChannel {
3629  uint32_t c1;
3630  uint32_t dly0;
3631  uint32_t dly1;
3632  };
3633 
3634  // Number of PDB channels
3635  static constexpr size_t numChannels = 1;
3636 
3637  // Default values for channel registers
3638  static constexpr PdbChannel pdb_ch[numChannels] = {
3639  { // Channel[0] Control Register 1
3640  PDB_C1_BB(0x0) | // Pre-Trigger Back-to-Back Operation Enable
3641  PDB_C1_TOS(0x0) | // Pre-Trigger Output Select
3642  PDB_C1_EN(0x0), // Pre-Trigger Enable
3643  PDB_DLY_DLY(0), // Channel[0] pre-trigger delay 0
3644  PDB_DLY_DLY(0), // Channel[0] pre-trigger delay 1
3645  },
3646  };
3647 
3648  // Number of DACs
3649  static constexpr size_t numDacs = 0;
3650 
3651  static constexpr uint32_t pdb_poen =
3652  PDB_POEN_POEN(0x0); // Pulse-Out Enable
3653 
3654  // Number of PDB pulse outputs
3655  static constexpr size_t numPulseOutputs = 2;
3656 
3657  static constexpr uint32_t pdb_podly[numPulseOutputs] = {
3658  // Pulse Output[0] Delays {
3659  PDB_PODLY_DLY1(0) | // Delay 1
3660  PDB_PODLY_DLY2(0), // Delay 2
3661 
3662  // Pulse Output[1] Delays
3663  PDB_PODLY_DLY1(0) | // Delay 1
3664  PDB_PODLY_DLY2(0), // Delay 2
3665  };
3666 
3667  /**
3668  * Get PDB clock frequency
3669  *
3670  * @return Frequency as a uint32_t in Hz
3671  */
3672  static __attribute__((always_inline)) uint32_t getInputClockFrequency() {
3673  return SystemBusClock;
3674  }
3675 
3676  //! IRQ numbers for hardware
3677  static constexpr IRQn_Type irqNums[] = PDB0_IRQS;
3678 
3679  //! Number of IRQs for hardware
3680  static constexpr uint32_t irqCount = sizeof(irqNums)/sizeof(irqNums[0]);
3681 
3682  //! Class based callback handler has been installed in vector table
3683  static constexpr bool irqHandlerInstalled = 0;
3684 
3685  //! Default IRQ level
3686  static constexpr uint32_t irqLevel = 8;
3687 
3688  /**
3689  * Enable clock to Pdb0
3690  */
3691  static void enableClock() {
3692 #ifdef PCC
3693  PccInfo::enablePdb0Clock();
3694 #else
3695  SIM->SCGC6 |= SIM_SCGC6_PDB_MASK;
3696 #endif
3697  }
3698 
3699  /**
3700  * Disable clock to Pdb0
3701  */
3702  static void disableClock() {
3703 #ifdef PCC
3704  PccInfo::disablePdb0Clock();
3705 #else
3706  SIM->SCGC6 &= ~SIM_SCGC6_PDB_MASK;
3707 #endif
3708  }
3709 
3710  //! Number of signals available in info table
3711  static constexpr int numSignals = 1;
3712 
3713  //! Information for each signal of peripheral
3714  static constexpr PinInfo info[] = {
3715 
3716  // Signal Pin portInfo gpioAddress gpioBit PCR value
3717  /* 0: PDB0_EXTRG = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
3718  };
3719 
3720  /**
3721  * Initialise pins used by peripheral
3722  *
3723  * @param pcrValue PCR value controlling pin options
3724  */
3725  static void initPCRs(uint32_t pcrValue=defaultPcrValue) {
3726  (void)pcrValue;
3727  }
3728 
3729  /**
3730  * Resets pins used by peripheral
3731  */
3732  static void clearPCRs() {
3733  }
3734 
3735 };
3736 
3737 /**
3738  * End group PDB_Group
3739  * @}
3740  */
3741 /**
3742  * @addtogroup PIT_Group PIT, Programmable Interrupt Timer
3743  * @brief Abstraction for Programmable Interrupt Timer
3744  * @{
3745  */
3746 #define USBDM_PIT_IS_DEFINED
3747 /**
3748  * Peripheral information for PIT, Programmable Interrupt Timer.
3749  *
3750  * This may include pin information, constants, register addresses, and default register values,
3751  * along with simple accessor functions.
3752  */
3753 class PitInfo {
3754 public:
3755  // Template:pit_4ch
3756 
3757  //! Number of PIT channels
3758  static constexpr uint32_t NumChannels = 4;
3759 
3760  //! Hardware base address as uint32_t
3761  static constexpr uint32_t baseAddress = PIT_BasePtr;
3762 
3763  //! Hardware base pointer
3764  __attribute__((always_inline)) static volatile PIT_Type &pit() {
3765  return *(PIT_Type *)baseAddress;
3766  }
3767 
3768  //! IRQ numbers for hardware
3769  static constexpr IRQn_Type irqNums[] = PIT_IRQS;
3770 
3771  //! Number of IRQs for hardware
3772  static constexpr uint32_t irqCount = sizeof(irqNums)/sizeof(irqNums[0]);
3773 
3774  //! Class based callback handler has been installed in vector table
3775  static constexpr bool irqHandlerInstalled = 1;
3776 
3777  //! Default IRQ level
3778  static constexpr uint32_t irqLevel = 8;
3779 
3780  //! Default value for PIT load value register
3781  static constexpr uint32_t pit_ldval = 4799;
3782 
3783  //! PIT operation in debug mode
3784  static constexpr uint32_t mcr =
3785  PIT_MCR_FRZ(0) | // Freeze in debug mode
3786  PIT_MCR_MDIS(0); // Disable
3787 
3788  /**
3789  * Get clock frequency
3790  *
3791  * @return Input clock frequency as a uint32_t in Hz
3792  */
3793  static __attribute__((always_inline)) uint32_t getClockFrequency() {
3794  return SystemBusClock;
3795  }
3796 
3797  /**
3798  * Enable clock to Pit
3799  */
3800  static void enableClock() {
3801 #ifdef PCC
3802  PccInfo::enablePitClock();
3803 #else
3804  SIM->SCGC6 |= SIM_SCGC6_PIT_MASK;
3805 #endif
3806  }
3807 
3808  /**
3809  * Disable clock to Pit
3810  */
3811  static void disableClock() {
3812 #ifdef PCC
3813  PccInfo::disablePitClock();
3814 #else
3815  SIM->SCGC6 &= ~SIM_SCGC6_PIT_MASK;
3816 #endif
3817  }
3818 
3819 };
3820 
3821 /**
3822  * End group PIT_Group
3823  * @}
3824  */
3825 /**
3826  * @addtogroup PMC_Group PMC, Power Management Controller
3827  * @brief Abstraction for Power Management Controller
3828  * @{
3829  */
3830 #define USBDM_PMC_IS_DEFINED
3831 /**

3835  * along with simple accessor functions.

3846  return *(PMC_Type *)baseAddress;
3847  }
3848

3850  static constexpr uint32_t pmc_lvdsc1 =
3851  #ifdef PMC_LVDSC1_LVDV
3852  PMC_LVDSC1_LVDV(0) | // Low-Voltage Detect Voltage Select
3853  #endif
3854  PMC_LVDSC1_LVDIE(0) | // Low-Voltage Detect Interrupt Enable
3855  PMC_LVDSC1_LVDRE(0); // Low-Voltage Detect Reset Enable
3856 
3857  //! Default value for Low Voltage Detect Status And Control 2 register
3858  static constexpr uint32_t pmc_lvdsc2 =
3859  #ifdef PMC_LVDSC2_LVWV
3860  PMC_LVDSC2_LVWV(0) | // Low-Voltage Warning Voltage Select
3861  #endif
3862  PMC_LVDSC2_LVWIE(0); // Low-Voltage Warning Interrupt Enable
3863 
3864  #ifdef PMC_REGSC_BGEN
3865  //! Default value for Regulator Status And Control register
3866  static constexpr uint32_t pmc_regsc =
3867  PMC_REGSC_BGEN(0) | // Bandgap Enable In VLPx Operation
3868  PMC_REGSC_BGBE(0); // Bandgap Buffer Enable
3869 
3870  #endif
3871  //! IRQ numbers for hardware
3872  static constexpr IRQn_Type irqNums[] = PMC_IRQS;
3873 
3874  //! Number of IRQs for hardware
3875  static constexpr uint32_t irqCount = sizeof(irqNums)/sizeof(irqNums[0]);
3876 
3877  //! Class based callback handler has been installed in vector table
3878  static constexpr bool irqHandlerInstalled = 0;
3879 
3880  //! Default IRQ level
3881  static constexpr uint32_t irqLevel = 8;
3882 
3883 };

3889 /**

3892  * @{

3901 class PowerInfo {

3908  //! Information for each signal of peripheral
3909  static constexpr PinInfo info[] = {
3910 
3911  // Signal Pin portInfo gpioAddress gpioBit PCR value
3912  /* 0: VBAT = VBAT (VBAT) */ { NoPortInfo, 0, FIXED_NO_PCR, 0 },
3913  /* 1: VDD1 = VDD1 (VDD1) */ { NoPortInfo, 0, FIXED_NO_PCR, 0 },
3914  /* 2: VDD2 = VDD2 (VDD2) */ { NoPortInfo, 0, FIXED_NO_PCR, 0 },
3915  /* 3: VDD3 = VDD3 (VDD3) */ { NoPortInfo, 0, FIXED_NO_PCR, 0 },
3916  /* 4: VDDA = VDDA (VDDA) */ { NoPortInfo, 0, FIXED_NO_PCR, 0 },
3917  /* 5: VOUT33 = VOUT33 (VOUT33) */ { NoPortInfo, 0, FIXED_NO_PCR, 0 },
3918  /* 6: VREFH = VREFH (VREFH) */ { NoPortInfo, 0, FIXED_NO_PCR, 0 },
3919  /* 7: VREFL = VREFL (VREFL) */ { NoPortInfo, 0, FIXED_NO_PCR, 0 },
3920  /* 8: VREGIN = VREGIN (VREGIN) */ { NoPortInfo, 0, FIXED_NO_PCR, 0 },
3921  /* 9: VSS1 = VSS1 (VSS1) */ { NoPortInfo, 0, FIXED_NO_PCR, 0 },
3922  /* 10: VSS2 = VSS2 (VSS2) */ { NoPortInfo, 0, FIXED_NO_PCR, 0 },
3923  /* 11: VSS3 = VSS3 (VSS3) */ { NoPortInfo, 0, FIXED_NO_PCR, 0 },
3924  /* 12: VSSA = VSSA (VSSA) */ { NoPortInfo, 0, FIXED_NO_PCR, 0 },
3925  };
3926 
3927 };

3954  return *(RCM_Type *)baseAddress;
3955  }
3956

3958  static constexpr uint8_t rcm_rpfc =
3959  RCM_RPFC_RSTFLTSS(0)| // Reset pin filter select in stop mode
3960  RCM_RPFC_RSTFLTSRW(0); // Reset pin filter select in run and wait modes
3961

3964  RCM_RPFW_RSTFLTSEL(0);

3975  * @{
3976  */
3977 #define USBDM_SMC_IS_DEFINED
3978 /**
3979  * Peripheral information for SMC, System Mode Controller.
3980  *
3981  * This may include pin information, constants, register addresses, and default register values,
3982  * along with simple accessor functions.
3983  */
3984 class SmcInfo {
3985 public:
3986  // Template:smc_mk10d5
3987 
3988  //! Hardware base address as uint32_t
3989  static constexpr uint32_t baseAddress = SMC_BasePtr;
3990 
3991  //! Hardware base pointer
3992  __attribute__((always_inline)) static volatile SMC_Type &smc() {
3993  return *(SMC_Type *)baseAddress;
3994  }
3995 
3996  // Power Mode Protection Register
3997  static constexpr uint8_t pmprot =
3998 #ifdef SMC_PMPROT_AHSRUN
3999  SMC_PMPROT_AHSRUN(0) | // Allow High Speed Run mode
4000 #endif
4001  SMC_PMPROT_AVLP(1) | // Allow very low power modes
4002  SMC_PMPROT_ALLS(1) | // Allow low leakage stop mode
4003  SMC_PMPROT_AVLLS(1); // Allow very low leakage stop mode
4004 
4005 #ifdef SMC_PMCTRL_LPWUI
4006  // Power Mode Control Register
4007  static constexpr uint8_t pmctrl =
4008  SMC_PMCTRL_LPWUI(1); // Low Power Wake Up on Interrupt
4009 
4010 #endif
4011 
4012  // VLLS Control Register
4013  static constexpr uint8_t stopctrl =
4014 #ifdef SMC_STOPCTRL_PSTOPO
4015  SMC_STOPCTRL_PSTOPO(0) | // Partial Stop Option (if present)
4016 #endif
4017 
4018  SMC_STOPCTRL_PORPO(0) | // POR Power Option
4019 #ifdef SMC_STOPCTRL_LPOPO
4020  SMC_STOPCTRL_LPOPO(0) | // POR Power Option (if present)
4021 #endif
4022 
4023  SMC_STOPCTRL_VLLSM(3); // LLS or VLLS Mode Control
4024 
4025 };

4030  */
4031 /**
4032  * @addtogroup SPI_Group SPI, Serial Peripheral Interface
4033  * @brief Abstraction for Serial Peripheral Interface
4034  * @{
4035  */
4036 #define USBDM_SPI0_IS_DEFINED
4037 /**
4038  * Peripheral information for SPI, Serial Peripheral Interface.
4039  *
4040  * This may include pin information, constants, register addresses, and default register values,
4041  * along with simple accessor functions.
4042  */
4043 class Spi0Info {
4044 public:
4045  // Template:spi0_mk_pcsis6
4046 
4047  //! Hardware base address as uint32_t
4048  static constexpr uint32_t baseAddress = SPI0_BasePtr;
4049 
4050  //! Hardware base pointer
4051  __attribute__((always_inline)) static volatile SPI_Type &spi() {
4052  return *(SPI_Type *)baseAddress;
4053  }
4054 
4055  //! Base value for PCR (excluding MUX value)
4056  static constexpr uint32_t defaultPcrValue =
4057  PORT_PCR_LK(0) | // Lock Register
4058  PORT_PCR_DSE(0) | // Drive Strength Enable
4059  PORT_PCR_ODE(0) | // Open Drain Enable
4060  PORT_PCR_PFE(0) | // Passive Filter Enable
4061  PORT_PCR_SRE(0) | // Slew Rate Enable
4062  PORT_PCR_PS(0); // Pull device
4063 
4064  //! Map all allocated pins on a peripheral when enabled
4065  static constexpr bool mapPinsOnEnable = true;
4066 
4067  //! IRQ numbers for hardware
4068  static constexpr IRQn_Type irqNums[] = SPI0_IRQS;
4069 
4070  //! Number of IRQs for hardware
4071  static constexpr uint32_t irqCount = sizeof(irqNums)/sizeof(irqNums[0]);
4072 
4073  //! Class based callback handler has been installed in vector table
4074  static constexpr bool irqHandlerInstalled = 0;
4075 
4076  //! Default IRQ level
4077  static constexpr uint32_t irqLevel = 8;
4078 
4079  /**
4080  * Enable clock to Spi0
4081  */
4082  static void enableClock() {
4083 #ifdef PCC
4084  PccInfo::enableSpi0Clock();
4085 #else
4086  SIM->SCGC6 |= SIM_SCGC6_SPI0_MASK;
4087 #endif
4088  }
4089 
4090  /**
4091  * Disable clock to Spi0
4092  */
4093  static void disableClock() {
4094 #ifdef PCC
4095  PccInfo::disableSpi0Clock();
4096 #else
4097  SIM->SCGC6 &= ~SIM_SCGC6_SPI0_MASK;
4098 #endif
4099  }
4100 
4101  //! Default communication clock phase and clock polarity (CPHA+CPOL)
4102  static constexpr uint32_t mode =
4103  SPI_CTAR_MODE(0);
4104 
4105  //! Default communication order (MSB/LSB first)
4106  static constexpr uint32_t lsbfe =
4107  SPI_CTAR_LSBFE(0);
4108 
4109  static uint32_t getClockFrequency() {
4110  return SystemBusClock;
4111  }
4112 
4113  //! Default speed (Hz)
4114  static constexpr uint32_t speed =
4115  10000000;
4116 
4117  //! Number of signals available in info table
4118  static constexpr int numSignals = 8;
4119 
4120  //! Information for each signal of peripheral
4121  static constexpr PinInfo info[] = {
4122 
4123  // Signal Pin portInfo gpioAddress gpioBit PCR value
4124  /* 0: SPI0_SCK = PTD1 (D13) */ { PortDInfo, GPIOD_BasePtr, 1, PORT_PCR_MUX(2)|defaultPcrValue },
4125  /* 1: SPI0_SIN = PTD3 (D12) */ { PortDInfo, GPIOD_BasePtr, 3, PORT_PCR_MUX(2)|defaultPcrValue },
4126  /* 2: SPI0_SOUT = PTD2 (D11) */ { PortDInfo, GPIOD_BasePtr, 2, PORT_PCR_MUX(2)|defaultPcrValue },
4127  /* 3: SPI0_PCS0 = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
4128  /* 4: SPI0_PCS1 = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
4129  /* 5: SPI0_PCS2 = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
4130  /* 6: SPI0_PCS3 = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
4131  /* 7: SPI0_PCS4 = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
4132  };
4133 
4134  /**
4135  * Initialise pins used by peripheral
4136  *
4137  * @param pcrValue PCR value controlling pin options
4138  */
4139  static void initPCRs(uint32_t pcrValue=defaultPcrValue) {
4140 #ifdef PCC_PCCn_CGC_MASK
4141  PCC->PCC_PORTD = PCC_PCCn_CGC_MASK;
4142 #else
4143  enablePortClocks(PORTD_CLOCK_MASK);
4144 #endif
4145  PORTD->GPCLR = pcrValue|PORT_PCR_MUX(2)|PORT_GPCLR_GPWE(0x000EUL);
4146  }
4147 
4148  /**
4149  * Resets pins used by peripheral
4150  */
4151  static void clearPCRs() {
4152 #ifdef PCC_PCCn_CGC_MASK
4153  PCC->PCC_PORTD = PCC_PCCn_CGC_MASK;
4154 #else
4155  enablePortClocks(PORTD_CLOCK_MASK);
4156 #endif
4157  PORTD->GPCLR = PORT_PCR_MUX(0)|PORT_GPCLR_GPWE(0xEU);
4158  }
4159 
4160 };
4161 
4162 /**
4163  * End group SPI_Group
4164  * @}
4165  */
4166 /**
4167  * @addtogroup TSI_Group TSI, Touch Sense Interface
4168  * @brief Abstraction for Touch Sense Interface
4169  * @{
4170  */
4171 #define USBDM_TSI0_IS_DEFINED
4172 /**
4173  * Peripheral information for TSI, Touch Sense Interface.
4174  *
4175  * This may include pin information, constants, register addresses, and default register values,
4176  * along with simple accessor functions.
4177  */
4178 class Tsi0Info {
4179 public:
4180  // Template:tsi0_mk
4181 
4182  //! Hardware base address as uint32_t
4183  static constexpr uint32_t baseAddress = TSI0_BasePtr;
4184 
4185  //! Hardware base pointer
4186  __attribute__((always_inline)) static volatile TSI_Type &tsi() {
4187  return *(TSI_Type *)baseAddress;
4188  }
4189 
4190  //! Base value for PCR (excluding MUX value)
4191  static constexpr uint32_t defaultPcrValue = 0;
4192 
4193  //! Map all allocated pins on a peripheral when enabled
4194  static constexpr bool mapPinsOnEnable = false;
4195 
4196  static constexpr uint32_t tsi_gencs = \
4197  TSI_GENCS_STPE(0) | // TSI STOP Enable
4198  TSI_GENCS_STM(0) | // Scan Trigger Mode
4199  TSI_GENCS_ESOR(1) | // EOS or OOR Interrupt select
4200  TSI_GENCS_ERIE(0) | // Error Interrupt Enable
4201  TSI_GENCS_TSIIE(0) | // Touch Sensing Input Interrupt Module Enable
4202  TSI_GENCS_PS(3) | // Electrode Oscillator Prescaler
4203  TSI_GENCS_NSCN(8-1) | // Consecutive Scan number
4204  TSI_GENCS_LPSCNITV(9) | // Low-Power Mode Scan Interval
4205  TSI_GENCS_LPCLKS(0); // Low-Power Mode Clock Source
4206 
4207  static constexpr uint32_t tsi_scanc = \
4208  TSI_SCANC_AMPSC(3) | // Active Mode Prescaler
4209  TSI_SCANC_AMCLKS(0) | // Active Mode Clock Source
4210  TSI_SCANC_SMOD(8) | // Scan Period Modulus
4211  TSI_SCANC_EXTCHRG((16/2)-1) | // External Oscillator Charge Current select
4212  TSI_SCANC_REFCHRG((16/2)-1); // Reference Oscillator Charge Current select
4213 
4214  static constexpr uint32_t tsi_pen = \
4215  (0x0) | // Pins enable channel as TSI inputs
4216  TSI_PEN_LPSP(0); // Low Power Scan channel
4217 
4218  static constexpr uint32_t tsi_threshold = \
4219  TSI_THRESHOLD_LTHH(0) | // Low Power Channel Low Threshold value
4220  TSI_THRESHOLD_HTHH(0); // Low Power Channel High Threshold value
4221 
4222  /**
4223  * Get input clock when configured in Active mode
4224  *
4225  * @return frequency on Hz
4226  */
4227  static uint32_t getInputClockFrequency() {
4228  switch(tsi().SCANC&TSI_SCANC_AMCLKS_MASK) {
4229  case TSI_SCANC_AMCLKS(0): return 1000;
4230  case TSI_SCANC_AMCLKS(1): return McgInfo::getMcgIrClock();
4231  case TSI_SCANC_AMCLKS(2): return Osc0Info::getOscerClock();
4232  }
4233  return 0;
4234  }
4235 
4236  /**
4237  * Get input clock when configured in low power mode
4238  *
4239  * @return frequency on Hz
4240  */
4241  static uint32_t getLowPowerInputClockFrequency() {
4242  switch(tsi().GENCS&TSI_GENCS_LPCLKS_MASK) {
4243  case TSI_GENCS_LPCLKS(0): return 1000;
4244  case TSI_GENCS_LPCLKS(1): return SimInfo::getErc32kClock();
4245  }
4246  return 0;
4247  }
4248 
4249  //! IRQ numbers for hardware
4250  static constexpr IRQn_Type irqNums[] = TSI0_IRQS;
4251 
4252  //! Number of IRQs for hardware
4253  static constexpr uint32_t irqCount = sizeof(irqNums)/sizeof(irqNums[0]);
4254 
4255  //! Class based callback handler has been installed in vector table
4256  static constexpr bool irqHandlerInstalled = 0;
4257 
4258  //! Default IRQ level
4259  static constexpr uint32_t irqLevel = 8;
4260 
4261  /**
4262  * Enable clock to Tsi0
4263  */
4264  static void enableClock() {
4265 #ifdef PCC
4266  PccInfo::enableTsi0Clock();
4267 #else
4268  SIM->SCGC5 |= SIM_SCGC5_TSI0_MASK;
4269 #endif
4270  }
4271 
4272  /**
4273  * Disable clock to Tsi0
4274  */
4275  static void disableClock() {
4276 #ifdef PCC
4277  PccInfo::disableTsi0Clock();
4278 #else
4279  SIM->SCGC5 &= ~SIM_SCGC5_TSI0_MASK;
4280 #endif
4281  }
4282 
4283  //! Number of signals available in info table
4284  static constexpr int numSignals = 16;
4285 
4286  //! Information for each signal of peripheral
4287  static constexpr PinInfo info[] = {
4288 
4289  // Signal Pin portInfo gpioAddress gpioBit PCR value
4290  /* 0: TSI0_CH0 = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
4291  /* 1: TSI0_CH1 = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
4292  /* 2: TSI0_CH2 = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
4293  /* 3: TSI0_CH3 = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
4294  /* 4: TSI0_CH4 = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
4295  /* 5: TSI0_CH5 = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
4296  /* 6: TSI0_CH6 = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
4297  /* 7: TSI0_CH7 = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
4298  /* 8: TSI0_CH8 = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
4299  /* 9: TSI0_CH9 = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
4300  /* 10: TSI0_CH10 = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
4301  /* 11: TSI0_CH11 = PTB18 (Touch1) */ { PortBInfo, GPIOB_BasePtr, 18, PORT_PCR_MUX(0)|defaultPcrValue },
4302  /* 12: TSI0_CH12 = PTB19 (Touch2) */ { PortBInfo, GPIOB_BasePtr, 19, PORT_PCR_MUX(0)|defaultPcrValue },
4303  /* 13: TSI0_CH13 = PTC0 (A0) */ { PortCInfo, GPIOC_BasePtr, 0, PORT_PCR_MUX(0)|defaultPcrValue },
4304  /* 14: TSI0_CH14 = PTC1 (A1) */ { PortCInfo, GPIOC_BasePtr, 1, PORT_PCR_MUX(0)|defaultPcrValue },
4305  /* 15: TSI0_CH15 = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
4306  };
4307 
4308  /**
4309  * Initialise pins used by peripheral
4310  *
4311  * @param pcrValue PCR value controlling pin options
4312  */
4313  static void initPCRs(uint32_t pcrValue=defaultPcrValue) {
4314 #ifdef PCC_PCCn_CGC_MASK
4315  PCC->PCC_PORTB = PCC_PCCn_CGC_MASK;
4316  PCC->PCC_PORTC = PCC_PCCn_CGC_MASK;
4317 #else
4318  enablePortClocks(PORTB_CLOCK_MASK|PORTC_CLOCK_MASK);
4319 #endif
4320  PORTB->GPCHR = pcrValue|PORT_PCR_MUX(0)|PORT_GPCHR_GPWE(0x000CUL);
4321  PORTC->GPCLR = pcrValue|PORT_PCR_MUX(0)|PORT_GPCLR_GPWE(0x0003UL);
4322  }
4323 
4324  /**
4325  * Resets pins used by peripheral
4326  */
4327  static void clearPCRs() {
4328 #ifdef PCC_PCCn_CGC_MASK
4329  PCC->PCC_PORTB = PCC_PCCn_CGC_MASK;
4330  PCC->PCC_PORTC = PCC_PCCn_CGC_MASK;
4331 #else
4332  enablePortClocks(PORTB_CLOCK_MASK|PORTC_CLOCK_MASK);
4333 #endif
4334  PORTB->GPCHR = PORT_PCR_MUX(0)|PORT_GPCHR_GPWE(0xCU);
4335  PORTC->GPCLR = PORT_PCR_MUX(0)|PORT_GPCLR_GPWE(0x3U);
4336  }
4337 
4338 };
4339 
4340 /**
4341  * End group TSI_Group
4342  * @}
4343  */
4344 /**
4345  * @addtogroup UART_Group UART, Universal Asynchronous Receiver/Transmitter
4346  * @brief Abstraction for Universal Asynchronous Receiver/Transmitter
4347  * @{
4348  */
4349 #define USBDM_UART0_IS_DEFINED
4350 /**
4351  * Peripheral information for UART, Universal Asynchronous Receiver/Transmitter.
4352  *
4353  * This may include pin information, constants, register addresses, and default register values,
4354  * along with simple accessor functions.
4355  */
4356 class Uart0Info {
4357 public:
4358  // Template:uart0_mk10d10_c7816_cea709
4359 
4360  //! Hardware base address as uint32_t
4361  static constexpr uint32_t baseAddress = UART0_BasePtr;
4362 
4363  //! Hardware base pointer
4364  __attribute__((always_inline)) static volatile UART_Type &uart() {
4365  return *(UART_Type *)baseAddress;
4366  }
4367 
4368  //! Base value for PCR (excluding MUX value)
4369  static constexpr uint32_t defaultPcrValue =
4370  PORT_PCR_LK(0) | // Lock Register
4371  PORT_PCR_DSE(0) | // Drive Strength Enable
4372  PORT_PCR_ODE(0) | // Open Drain Enable
4373  PORT_PCR_PFE(0) | // Passive Filter Enable
4374  PORT_PCR_SRE(0) | // Slew Rate Enable
4375  PORT_PCR_PS(0); // Pull device
4376 
4377  //! Map all allocated pins on a peripheral when enabled
4378  static constexpr bool mapPinsOnEnable = false;
4379 
4380  //! IRQ numbers for hardware
4381  static constexpr IRQn_Type irqNums[] = UART0_IRQS;
4382 
4383  //! Number of IRQs for hardware
4384  static constexpr uint32_t irqCount = sizeof(irqNums)/sizeof(irqNums[0]);
4385 
4386  //! Class based callback handler has been installed in vector table
4387  static constexpr bool irqHandlerInstalled = 0;
4388 
4389  //! Default IRQ level
4390  static constexpr uint32_t irqLevel = 8;
4391 
4392  /**
4393  * Enable clock to Uart0
4394  */
4395  static void enableClock() {
4396 #ifdef PCC
4397  PccInfo::enableUart0Clock();
4398 #else
4399  SIM->SCGC4 |= SIM_SCGC4_UART0_MASK;
4400 #endif
4401  }
4402 
4403  /**
4404  * Disable clock to Uart0
4405  */
4406  static void disableClock() {
4407 #ifdef PCC
4408  PccInfo::disableUart0Clock();
4409 #else
4410  SIM->SCGC4 &= ~SIM_SCGC4_UART0_MASK;
4411 #endif
4412  }
4413 
4414  //! Indicates whether the UART needs a write to clear status errors
4415  static constexpr bool statusNeedsWrite = false;
4416 
4417  //! Default Baud rate used if not explicitly given
4418  static constexpr uint32_t defaultBaudRate = 115200;
4419 
4420  //! Default buffer size for receive queue when interrupt driven
4421  static constexpr unsigned receiveBufferSize = 50;
4422 
4423  //! Default buffer size for transmit queue when interrupt driven
4424  static constexpr unsigned transmitBufferSize = 50;
4425 
4426  /**
4427  * Get input clock frequency
4428  *
4429  * @return Input clock frequency as a uint32_t in Hz
4430  */
4431  static inline uint32_t getInputClockFrequency() {
4432  return SimInfo::getUart0Clock();
4433  }
4434 
4435  //! Number of signals available in info table
4436  static constexpr int numSignals = 5;
4437 
4438  //! Information for each signal of peripheral
4439  static constexpr PinInfo info[] = {
4440 
4441  // Signal Pin portInfo gpioAddress gpioBit PCR value
4442  /* 0: UART0_TX = PTB17 (ConTx) */ { PortBInfo, GPIOB_BasePtr, 17, PORT_PCR_MUX(3)|defaultPcrValue },
4443  /* 1: UART0_RX = PTB16 (ConRx) */ { PortBInfo, GPIOB_BasePtr, 16, PORT_PCR_MUX(3)|defaultPcrValue },
4444  /* 2: UART0_RTS_b = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
4445  /* 3: UART0_CTS_b = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
4446  /* 4: UART0_COL_b = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
4447  };
4448 
4449  /**
4450  * Initialise pins used by peripheral
4451  *
4452  * @param pcrValue PCR value controlling pin options
4453  */
4454  static void initPCRs(uint32_t pcrValue=defaultPcrValue) {
4455 #ifdef PCC_PCCn_CGC_MASK
4456  PCC->PCC_PORTB = PCC_PCCn_CGC_MASK;
4457 #else
4458  enablePortClocks(PORTB_CLOCK_MASK);
4459 #endif
4460  PORTB->GPCHR = pcrValue|PORT_PCR_MUX(3)|PORT_GPCHR_GPWE(0x0003UL);
4461  }
4462 
4463  /**
4464  * Resets pins used by peripheral
4465  */
4466  static void clearPCRs() {
4467 #ifdef PCC_PCCn_CGC_MASK
4468  PCC->PCC_PORTB = PCC_PCCn_CGC_MASK;
4469 #else
4470  enablePortClocks(PORTB_CLOCK_MASK);
4471 #endif
4472  PORTB->GPCHR = PORT_PCR_MUX(0)|PORT_GPCHR_GPWE(0x3U);
4473  }
4474 
4475 };
4476 
4477 #define USBDM_UART1_IS_DEFINED

4493  return *(UART_Type *)baseAddress;
4494  }

4498  PORT_PCR_LK(0) | // Lock Register
4499  PORT_PCR_DSE(0) | // Drive Strength Enable
4500  PORT_PCR_ODE(0) | // Open Drain Enable
4501  PORT_PCR_PFE(0) | // Passive Filter Enable

4528 #endif
4529  }

4537 #else

4539 #endif

4568

4570  /* 0: UART1_TX = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
4571  /* 1: UART1_RX = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
4572  /* 2: UART1_RTS_b = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
4573  /* 3: UART1_CTS_b = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },
4574  };

4582  (void)pcrValue;
4583  }

4782  /* 1: USB0_DP = USB0_DP (USB0_DP) */ { NoPortInfo, 0, FIXED_NO_PCR, 0 },
4783  /* 2: USB_CLKIN = -- */ { NoPortInfo, 0, UNMAPPED_PCR, 0 },

4808 /**

4810  * @brief Abstraction for USB Device Charger Detection
4811  * @{
4812  */
4813 #define USBDM_USBDCD0_IS_DEFINED
4814 /**
4815  * Peripheral information for USBDCD, USB Device Charger Detection.
4816  *
4817  * This may include pin information, constants, register addresses, and default register values,
4818  * along with simple accessor functions.
4819  */
4820 class Usbdcd0Info {
4821 public:
4822  // Template:usbdcd0_v1_1
4823 
4824  using USBHSDCD_Type = USBDCD_Type;
4825 
4826  //! Hardware base address as uint32_t
4827  static constexpr uint32_t baseAddress = USBDCD0_BasePtr;
4828 
4829  //! Hardware base pointer
4830  __attribute__((always_inline)) static volatile USBDCD_Type &usbdcd() {
4831  return *(USBDCD_Type *)baseAddress;
4832  }
4833 
4834  //! IRQ numbers for hardware
4835  static constexpr IRQn_Type irqNums[] = USBDCD0_IRQS;
4836 
4837  //! Number of IRQs for hardware
4838  static constexpr uint32_t irqCount = sizeof(irqNums)/sizeof(irqNums[0]);
4839 
4840  //! Class based callback handler has been installed in vector table
4841  static constexpr bool irqHandlerInstalled = 0;
4842 
4843  //! Default IRQ level
4844  static constexpr uint32_t irqLevel = 8;
4845 
4846  /**
4847  * Enable clock to Usbdcd0
4848  */
4849  static void enableClock() {
4850 #ifdef PCC
4851  PccInfo::enableUsbdcd0Clock();
4852 #else
4853  SIM->SCGC6 |= SIM_SCGC6_USBDCD_MASK;
4854 #endif
4855  }
4856 
4857  /**
4858  * Disable clock to Usbdcd0
4859  */
4860  static void disableClock() {
4861 #ifdef PCC
4862  PccInfo::disableUsbdcd0Clock();
4863 #else
4864  SIM->SCGC6 &= ~SIM_SCGC6_USBDCD_MASK;
4865 #endif
4866  }
4867 
4868 };
4869 
4870 /**
4871  * End group USBDCD_Group
4872  * @}
4873  */
4874 /**
4875  * @addtogroup VREF_Group VREF, Voltage Reference
4876  * @brief Abstraction for Voltage Reference
4877  * @{
4878  */
4879 #define USBDM_VREF_IS_DEFINED
4880 /**
4881  * Peripheral information for VREF, Voltage Reference.
4882  *
4883  * This may include pin information, constants, register addresses, and default register values,
4884  * along with simple accessor functions.
4885  */
4886 class VrefInfo {
4887 public:
4888  // Template:vref_c
4889 
4890  //! Hardware base address as uint32_t
4891  static constexpr uint32_t baseAddress = VREF_BasePtr;
4892 
4893  //! Hardware base pointer
4894  __attribute__((always_inline)) static volatile VREF_Type &vref() {
4895  return *(VREF_Type *)baseAddress;
4896  }
4897 
4898  //! Base value for PCR (excluding MUX value)
4899  static constexpr uint32_t defaultPcrValue = 0;
4900 
4901  //! Map all allocated pins on a peripheral when enabled
4902  static constexpr bool mapPinsOnEnable = false;
4903 
4904  static constexpr uint8_t vref_trm =
4905  VREF_TRM_CHOPEN(1) | // Chop oscillator enable
4906  VREF_TRM_TRIM(32); // Trim bits
4907 
4908  static constexpr uint8_t vref_sc =
4909  VREF_SC_VREFEN(1) | // Internal Voltage Reference enable
4910  VREF_SC_REGEN(1) | // Regulator enable
4911  VREF_SC_ICOMPEN(1) | // Second order curvature compensation enable
4912  VREF_SC_MODE_LV(1); // Buffer Mode selection
4913 
4914  /**
4915  * Enable clock to Vref
4916  */
4917  static void enableClock() {
4918 #ifdef PCC
4919  PccInfo::enableVrefClock();
4920 #else
4921  SIM->SCGC4 |= SIM_SCGC4_VREF_MASK;
4922 #endif
4923  }
4924 
4925  /**
4926  * Disable clock to Vref
4927  */
4928  static void disableClock() {
4929 #ifdef PCC
4930  PccInfo::disableVrefClock();
4931 #else
4932  SIM->SCGC4 &= ~SIM_SCGC4_VREF_MASK;
4933 #endif
4934  }
4935 
4936  //! Number of signals available in info table
4937  static constexpr int numSignals = 1;
4938 
4939  //! Information for each signal of peripheral
4940  static constexpr PinInfo info[] = {
4941 
4942  // Signal Pin portInfo gpioAddress gpioBit PCR value
4943  /* 0: VREF_OUT = VREF_OUT (A6) */ { NoPortInfo, 0, FIXED_NO_PCR, 0 },
4944  };
4945 
4946  /**
4947  * Initialise pins used by peripheral
4948  *
4949  * @param pcrValue PCR value controlling pin options
4950  */
4951  static void initPCRs(uint32_t pcrValue=defaultPcrValue) {
4952  (void)pcrValue;
4953  }
4954 
4955  /**
4956  * Resets pins used by peripheral
4957  */
4958  static void clearPCRs() {
4959  }
4960 
4961 };
4962 
4963 /**
4964  * End group VREF_Group
4965  * @}
4966  */
4967 /**
4968  * @addtogroup WDOG_Group WDOG, Watchdog Timer
4969  * @brief Abstraction for Watchdog Timer
4970  * @{
4971  */
4972 #define USBDM_WDOG_IS_DEFINED
4973 /**
4974  * Peripheral information for WDOG, Watchdog Timer.
4975  *
4976  * This may include pin information, constants, register addresses, and default register values,
4977  * along with simple accessor functions.
4978  */
4979 class WdogInfo {
4980 public:
4981  // Template:wdog_mk
4982 
4983  //! Hardware base address as uint32_t
4984  static constexpr uint32_t baseAddress = WDOG_BasePtr;
4985 
4986  //! Hardware base pointer
4987  __attribute__((always_inline)) static volatile WDOG_Type &wdog() {
4988  return *(WDOG_Type *)baseAddress;
4989  }
4990 
4991  //! IRQ numbers for hardware
4992  static constexpr IRQn_Type irqNums[] = WDOG_IRQS;
4993 
4994  //! Number of IRQs for hardware
4995  static constexpr uint32_t irqCount = sizeof(irqNums)/sizeof(irqNums[0]);
4996 
4997  //! Class based callback handler has been installed in vector table
4998  static constexpr bool irqHandlerInstalled = 0;
4999 
5000  //! Default IRQ level
5001  static constexpr uint32_t irqLevel = 8;
5002 
5003  /**
5004  * Get input clock frequency
5005  *
5006  * @return Input clock frequency as a uint32_t in Hz
5007  */
5008  static uint32_t getInputClockFrequency() {
5009 
5010  switch(wdog().STCTRLH&WDOG_STCTRLH_CLKSRC_MASK) {
5011  default:
5012  case WDOG_STCTRLH_CLKSRC(0): return SystemLpoClock; // LPO
5013  case WDOG_STCTRLH_CLKSRC(1): return SystemBusClock; // Alt = System Bus Clock
5014  }
5015  }
5016 
5017 };
5018 
5019 /**
5020  * End group WDOG_Group
5021  * @}
5022  */
5023 /**
5024  * End group USBDM_Group
5025  * @}
5026  */
5027 
5028 } // End namespace USBDM
5029

5032 #include "ftm.h"
5033 #include "gpio.h"

5037  */

5040 /**
5041  * @addtogroup USBDM_Group USBDM Peripheral Interface
5042  * @brief Hardware Peripheral Interface and library
5043  * @{
5044  */
5045 /**
5046  * @addtogroup ADC_Group ADC, Analogue Input
5047  * @brief Abstraction for Analogue Input
5048  * @{
5049  */
5050 using Adc_A11 = const USBDM::Adc0::Channel<19>;
5051 using Adc_A9 = const USBDM::Adc0::Channel<21>;
5052 using Adc_A10 = const USBDM::Adc0::Channel<0>;
5053 using Adc_A8 = const USBDM::Adc0::Channel<3>;
5054 using Adc_A7 = const USBDM::Adc0::Channel<23>;
5055 using Adc_A0 = const USBDM::Adc0::Channel<14>;
5056 using Adc_A1 = const USBDM::Adc0::Channel<15>;
5057 using Adc_A3 = const USBDM::Adc0::Channel<6>;
5058 using Adc_A2 = const USBDM::Adc0::Channel<7>;
5059 /**
5060  * End group ADC_Group
5061  * @}
5062  */
5063 /**
5064  * @addtogroup FTM_Group FTM, PWM, Input capture and Output compare
5065  * @brief Abstraction for PWM, Input capture and Output compare
5066  * @{
5067  */
5068 using Ftm_D5 = const USBDM::Ftm0::Channel<6>;
5069 using Ftm_D9 = const USBDM::Ftm0::Channel<7>;
5070 using Ftm_LED_BLUE = const USBDM::Ftm0::Channel<7>;
5071 using Ftm_D21 = const USBDM::Ftm0::Channel<1>;
5072 using Ftm_D6 = const USBDM::Ftm0::Channel<2>;
5073 using Ftm_LED_RED = const USBDM::Ftm0::Channel<2>;
5074 using Ftm_D7 = const USBDM::Ftm0::Channel<3>;
5075 using Ftm_D24 = const USBDM::Ftm1::Channel<1>;
5076 /**
5077  * End group FTM_Group
5078  * @}
5079  */
5080 /**
5081  * End group USBDM_Group
5082  * @}
5083  */
